A78 INT OR EXT. SOMEWHERE IN THE CITY
FROM THE UNDERGROUND. A YOUNG NIGGA
A17 THE BACK OF THE CLUB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bucket pulls up in front of a shitty-looking BROWN HOUS with ugly bars on the windows and doors. A rusted swing-s leans sideways on the dirt/grass they call a front lawn.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: Inside the car is ERIC WRIGHT, 21, but you know him as --

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: A man who is completely in his element -- comfortable and poised, ready for anything. He hops out of the car, moves quickly to the TRUNK -- pop open and reaches inside. With an electric screwdriver, Ea unscrews a CERWIN-VEGA sub-woofer. Grabs a bulging BROWN out of the speaker... and a 9mm -- SLAMS the trunk. ON THE ROOF, a LOOKOUT clocks Eazy as he walks up to the front door of the decrepit house... Eazy KNOCKS BY CODE. A dude, TONE (20s), opens a slat in door. Gauges Eazy, EYES SKEPTICAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric! Man, we been through this shit a thousand times. Multiple DEADBOLTS UNLOCK and an irritated Eazy enters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the use to having this dumb ass knock if I gotta tell you my name anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not what you'd call "cozy." The carpet is torn up, stained, cigarette-burnt. Walls covered in TAGS. A PITBUL stares menacingly from the kitchen. In addition to Eazy and Tone, there are THREE other peopl spread around the room: one GIRL lounges on a vinyl couch eyes glazed; another girl, TASHA, loudly SCRAPES soul foo onto the pitbull's plate; and a JITTERY DUDE steady keeps EYE out the WINDOW, tense, occasionally clocking -- EAZY spreads the CONTENTS of the BROWN BAG before them on long TABLE: three FREEZER BAGS each containing 10 ounces. looks up, ALL BUSINESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now where the money at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, you heard what happen? My best runner got cracked. They sent his young ass to Y.A. --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck that got to do with me? Tone turns to Tasha in the kitchen, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tasha, get this dude a 40. TASHA opens the fridge, grabs a 40oz. --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look thirsty to you? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where my ends at? -- hands it to Tone who CRACKS it open. Drinks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you so ruthless, Eric, damn! You don't want nothin' to drink? What you want -- (re: the girls)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- you want some pussy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. But not from these strawberry bitches you got right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you just gonna disrespect my house like that, Cuz? EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dumb ass, this a dope house! It's already disrespected. JITTERY DUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Eazy's drugs) Well fuck it then -- You gonna have to let us hold on to that right there. ON THE COUCH, the GIRL grabs a SAWED-OFF SHOTGUN FROM UND PILLOW. Levels it at Eazy, face grimaced, hard, strung ou EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, do what you gotta do -- `Cause I got my homies parked across the street from your momma's house. I don't show up. They show out... Eazy just stares right back at them. The tension's like a pressure cooker about to burst. Until -- A WHISTLE echoes in from outside (THE LOOKOUT) -- Suddenly, everyone notices a deep RUMBLING coming from outside. Jittery Dude steps back from the window, eyes wi JITTERY DUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit -- Because there's a MASSIVE ARMORED VEHICLE rolling down th street toward them. 6 TONS of steel, with a 14-foot BATTE RAM mounted on the front. LAPD emblazoned on the side. JITTERY DUDE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' Batter-Ram! Everyone in the room FLIES into action, STASHING the WEAP and the MONEY into hidden STASH SPOTS all over the HOUSE: Behind fake-panel LIGHT SWITCHES, hidden HATCHES beneath FLOORBOARDS, in a fake-panel inside the FRIDGE. It's some serious MACGYVER SHIT. Eazy grabs his ROCKS, BEE-LINES for the BACK of the HOUSE eyes wide, amped on adrenaline as the RUMBLING ESCALATES an almost UNBEARABLE LEVEL -- CRASH!!! The 14-foot BATTERING RAM PUNCHES THROUGH THE WA DEBRIS FLIES EVERYWHERE. The RAM keeps coming until --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GIRLS SCREAM! The ARMORED VEHICLE REVERSES, the BATTE RAM POLE YANKING THE ENTIRE WALL OUT WITH IT, leaving a MASSIVE RAGGED HOLE where we can see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOUSE -- lots of YELLING as they PIN everyone to the floor, it's too late, nobody can escape; nobody but

EAZY-E kicks out a KITCHEN window, squeezes through, hits dirt on the side of the house. Sprints past -- A PITBULL! The GROWLING DOG hustles for Eazy as a FLASHLI hits Eazy's back, a COP giving chase! As they race across the back yard, the Pitbull diverts to cop, who panics. He's about to get mauled until -- ANOTHER COP pops around the corner! Blasts the dog with a FIRE EXTINGUISHER, filling the air with a dense cloud of expellant, as -- Eazy hops on a fence, hits the garage roof and jumps in a neighbor's yard. Gone. He lives to slang another day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the SOUNDS OF CHAOS carry over, infiltrate the inky black: SIRENS HOWLING. PEOPLE SHOUTING. HELICOPTERS BUZZI DOGS BARKING. A mad medley that continues into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PAIR OF OVERSIZED HEADPHONES, worn by ANDRE YOUNG. Bett known as В­-

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: Eyes closed, lying on his bed, slight smile pursing his l he bobs his head as -- WE HEAR WHAT HE HEARS, treated to the beautiful mind of D THE SOUNDS OF CHAOS are evaporated, seemingly synthesized into the dope melody Dre's peacefully bobbing his head to WE HEAR the multi-tracks of the song -- levels go up and based on Dre's subtle FACIAL REACTIONS to the various sou He singles out INDIVIDUAL ELEMENTS, and as he does, WE HE them, highlighting some sounds, decreasing others: BASS, DRUMS, PIANO, VOICE... It's pure instinct, pure joy. Unti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM-BAM! A fist on a locked door. The music stops as Dre removes his headphones. We now see -- DRE'S ROOM, populated with turn tables -- one side spinni the record he's listening to -- DJ station and a vast sea LPs (sure there's Parliament, but also Duke Ellington) scattered around the room. A music junkie's paradise. On the other bed, his brother TYREE (17) chills as Dre op the door to find -- VERNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? VERNA GRIFFIN, 36, his Mother, and she can smell bullshit mile away. He flashes his smooth, easy, magnetic Dre-smil DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened with what? VERNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre, boy, don't play with me. Do you even care how it makes me look? Call in favors to get your thoughtless ass an interview? And you can't even show up? DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs, realizing) Sorry, I just been so focused on this DJing that I forgot -- She frowns, shakes her head. VERNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a child, Andre. And spinning records ain't payin' none of the bills around here right now. DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't even true, momma. I get paid -- He pulls out a sad little wad of bills, waves it in her f Quick as lightning, she SNATCHES it away from him -- VERNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty dollars? Damn, you a billionaire! -- THROWS it back at his chest. DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a start --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VERNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre, you know the rules around here. In this house, you gonna work or go to school. I don't care if you gonna be a janitor -- DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- long as I own the company. Yeah, I know. Dre fumes, gather the bills off the floor, heads for the kitchen -- VERNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you don't own the company. Lonzo does. -- but Verna stays hot on his heels -- VERNA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you think we're done here? Dre keeps going, MUTTERS under his breath -- She grabs hi shoulder, SPINS him around, strong. Gets in his face. VERNA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got somethin' to say to me!? DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explodes) You don't care what I'm fighting for. I already know what I wanna do with my life, and it definitely ain't sittin in a cubicle takin' orders on som stupid ass job. Verna's eyes FLASH -- WHAP! She SLAPS HIM IN THE FACE -- Dre steps back, puts his hand to his cheek. Verna's reeli as much as he is. She tries to compose herself. VERNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People used to tell me I was too young when I had you -- Said I wouldn't be shit, said you wouldn't be shit. Now I been workin' my ass off to get us here and I refuse to let you throw it all away. Dre holds Verna's gaze a moment longer, then turns and ca walks back past her, into his room. He picks up his headphones, pull-out car stereo. Heads for the door, open it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regret)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre -- But he's already closed the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre bounds over to a battered BLUE & WHITE DATSUN B-2 parked in the DRIVEWAY, regret settling in. He looks up t see Tyree ambling closer, carrying a bundle of errantly- selected clothes, a crate of records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grabbed some of your stuff, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good lookin' out. Dre takes the clothes. Tosses them in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you comin' back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Gotta figure some things out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been fightin' for your own room this whole time and now you wanna come with me? They share a CHUCKLE. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know she's just want the best for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, T. I want the best for me too -- that's way I gotta go. Him and Dre have special brother-to-brother embrace. Then hops into his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I get set up right, I'mma have you come with me. Don't worry about it. It's gonna be sooner then you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyree sullenly nods. Dre triggers the ignition, MUSIC BLASTING, and PEELS away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre rolls along   in that ugly-ass Datsun. It's still ear but the STREETS   are starting to FILL UP. Dudes in doorw on the corners,   clocking him as he passes. An LA SHERIF DEPT. SQUAD CAR   slides past, disappears around a corner WE HEAR a HELICOPTER SOUND, as WE GO WIDE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flying high over the city, it's quiet up here, only the s of WIND. BELOW, we see the tight grids of SOUTH LOS ANGEL and the densely-packed TRAFFIC heading north along the 11 FREEWAY, as it angles toward the SKYSCRAPERS of DOWNTOWN We move NORTH and there's DODGER STADIUM plunked at the southern tip of ELYSIAN PARK, and the LA RIVER twisting snakelike up into GRIFFITH PARK -- And NORTHWEST past the mountains of Griffith, descending the VALLEY, where we suddenly DIVE DOWN into WOODLAND HIL and settle upon the low-slung sprawl of --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We track backward through a school bus full of STUDENTS. Almost exclusively black and Latino kids. Late 80's fashi All the way in the BACK ROW we settle on O'SHEA JACKSON, we now know as --

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: Raiders cap pulled low over a shoulder-length Jheri curl. Hunched over, wearing a soon-to-be-iconic FROWN of concentration, he SCRIBBLES LYRICS into a NOTEBOOK:

dialogues.speaker: WHERE MY HOMEBOYS CHILL --"
dialogues.text: The ROAR of a powerful sports car snaps Cube's concentrat He gazes out the school bus window to see that -- In stark contrast to those on the bus, just beyond the gl is a sea of WHITE STUDENTS. They hang out, shoot the shit their nice clothes, hop into their nice cars. It's a club that Cube isn't a part of and it's clear that he can feel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He frowns, looks back down at his notebook as the bus pul away from Taft High...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BUS cruises Southbound on Crenshaw. And compared to t Valley, it looks like BEIRUT out there: Graffiti tags, li stores everywhere, boarded-up shops, DUDES loitering, drinking, slanging. Crip throws a rock and hits the bus. FIND CUBE sitting halfway back, still doing his thing, writing rhymes, minding his own. NEAR HIM, a few KIDS goof around, flash GANG SIGNS out th window at the passing CARS, PEDESTRIANS, not noticing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulling out of a side street onto Crenshaw, we see two ha looking O.G. BLOODS. As the bus passes, they CLOCK THE KI flashing SIGNS. They can't believe it. Driver Grits his teeth. SPEEDS OUT after the bus --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus rolls to a stop. Before any KIDS can get off -- t O.G. Bloods' truck pulls in front of the bus, blocking th road. Passenger hops out. Noticing, the BUS DRIVER goes to shut the doors, but he's late -- O.G. Blood gets on, strides past the BUS DRIVER - glock 9mm in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey what's going on? --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up, Blood! (Addresses the whole bus)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You young muthafuckas wanna die today?! Everyone on the bus falls SILENT. By the shocked expressi on the kids' faces, they have no clue how or if they're g get out of this alive.

dialogues.speaker: HUH
dialogues.text: He makes his way back to the WANNABE KIDS near the expressionless Cube. Sensing shit is about to jump off, C slowly reaches for the WINDOW next to him, starts SLIDING OPEN. He edges closer to the window, grabs his NOTEBOOK, fully prepared to jump the fuck out that window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You little Crab ass niggas could've got this whole bus shot the fuck up! We saw that bullshit you was throwing up out the window! Hit me up now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't mean nothin' by it -- just playing around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's yo muthafuckin problem, Blood! This shit ain't nuthin' ta play wit! It's real in the field, nigga! Shit's life and death! I kill Crips for breakfast, Blood! So keep yo' mothafuckin hand down when you see me, Understand?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. The O.G. Blood looks over his shoulder, scowls at all the terrified faces staring back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you little muthafuckas need to do is start gangbang them got damn books! Learn some shit better then what we doing! If not, I might be the one that kill yo' dumb ass! Remember me! This that Crenshaw Mafia, Blood! And with that, the O.G. Blood tucks his gun, and calmly e the bus -- leaving behind the stunned kids. Their truck pulls away into traffic. Cube grab his books, get up to exit the bus along with a others, but not before glancing over at the kids, who sit there sweating, shell-shocked. Cube shakes his head at the wannabes. No way he's going o like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cube walks along the streets, Pee Chee folder and noteboo in hand, books under his arm as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're given tour of the sights and sounds of South Centra The pervasive shudder of LAPD CHOPPERS TAUNT OVERHEAD, DO BARKING, as an LAPD SQUAD CAR CRUISES MENACINGLY PAST lik shark in festive waters. Up ahead, BLOCK DUDES loiter on a neighbor's untended gra BLOCK DUDE 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw shit, here come Doug E. Fresh! BLOCK DUDE 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell naw, that's Kurtis mothafuckin Blow. Only rapper with a Jheri curl. ICE CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you niggas. I'm about to go write a rap about yo' drunk ass Momma. That bitch looks like The Egyptian Lover. They smile, give Cube a pound as he passes. Yell after hi BLOCK DUDE 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you never hang out no more? BLOCK DUDE 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's that Valley school. Nigga too good for us. But Cube just smiles, looks back at them -- CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I already know how to gangbang. I'm just tryin' to learn how to make some of this white people money. BLOCK DUDE 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel you, Cuz. I need some white people money too. ICE CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well take yo' ass to school sometimes. The Dudes laugh as Cube continues on. Keeps moving. UP AHEAD, he sees Dre's DATSUN parked across the street. question where Cube's headed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cube walks through the LIVING ROOM, where Dre's girlfrien LAVETTA, is feeding their baby TYRA (2) --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Dre at? She points to the back room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JINX'S ROOM, dirty but very hip-hop. JINX, 17, is digging through a crate of RECORDS, and offering them up to DRE, waves most of them away because -- DRE'S IN THE ZONE, doing his thing on the turntables, mix SCRATCHING. And whatever it is sounds DOPE. Next-level sh Cube enters -- Lets the SONIC ACROBATICS BOOMING from Dre turntables marinate on him a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you mixin'? Dre, lost in the music, doesn't respond -- Jinx holds up ALBUM COVERS: The Ohio Players' FUNKY WORM and The Headhunters' GOD MADE ME FUNKY. Doesn't make sense, yet -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blown away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohio Players and the Headhunters..? (to Dre) That's the shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crazy, right! Dre finally notices Cube's in front of him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wuddup, Cube! Got them rhymes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it. Cube flashes the SHEET OF LYRICS from school at Dre, noti the trash bag full of clothes on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stayin' a while?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. His momma kicked him out for that mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man that mouth always gettin' you in trouble. We got that in common.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think you ready for Doo-to's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Cause you know that's Compton, right? They got bodybags at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't worried about all that. I'mma come with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you better, `cause if your shit ain't tight, you might end up in one. Laughs all around as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Chevy Caprice cop car, light-bar strobing, has pulled aggressively onto the curb, all four doors open. CRASH OFFICERS roughly frisk the Block Dudes, as -- School shit in hand, Cube walks past, inconspicuous as possible. Can't help but glance at the scene --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck you lookin' at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin'. Just goin' home --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get over here! Now! Hesitant, Cube complies. Used to getting jacked by the police, he assumes the same position the other Block Dude are in: hands on the hood, legs back. One of the other Crash Cops pulls out his WALKIE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into walkie-talkie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Requesting backup on Van Wick Street. Gang related --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you figure we in a gang? `Cause we black? BAM! Crash Cop 1 shoves Cube against the car, kicking his legs apart, a hand on the back of his head. Cube's NOTEBO hit the pavement -- Get trampled. CUBE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo watch my notebooks! CRASH COP 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the rocks at, Cuz? BLOCK DUDE 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't no rocks! Y'all muthafuckas just fishin'! WHAM! Crash Cop 2 SLAMS Block Dude 1. Forces him to inter his fingers behind his head -- CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer, can you please explain why you jackin' us? CRASH COP 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have to explain shit! Block Dude 1 HOWLS in pain as Crash Cop 2 viciously SQUEE his interlocked knuckles. Crash Cop 1 shoots a look to Uniform Cop 2: Settle down, dude! TWO MORE SQUAD CARS SCREECH onto the scene. Four UNIFORME POLICE climb out, to make an even bigger deal out of noth Cube's Dad, HOSIE, appears up on the porch, pissed. HOSIE JACKSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What the hell's goin' on out here? Those boys all live on this block! The Cops ignore him as Cube's mother, DORIS, appears besi Hosie, shocked to see her son getting assaulted -- DORIS JACKSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Cube) Officer, that's my son! UNIFORM COP 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back inside, ma'am! But she starts coming down the steps toward the Cop -- He UNSNAPS his holster, hand grasping his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanna know what's going on -- The COP jams a FINGER inches away from Doris' face!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the FUCK BACK INSIDE, Lady, or I promise I will ruin your night! Doris' mouth drops open. The disrespect is incredible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't gotta talk to my moms like that, man! Uniform Cop 1 leans down, WHISPERS to Cube --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think we give a fuck? This LAPD, boy! Crash Unit! We the only gangstas around here! WIDE SHOT: Cube, his parents, and the Block Dudes helples held hostage in their own neighborhood. After every pocke turned out, body patted down and rights violated --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, they check out. We got cards on all of `em already. (to Cube and Co.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay out of trouble. The cops pile back into their cars leaving behind the stu neighborhood. Cube grabs his NOTEBOOKS, cleans them off a A CHOPPER ABOVE DEAFENS ALL SOUND in a PRIMORDIAL ROAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muffled MUSIC seeps into the area as SECURITY GUARDS thoroughly SEARCH everyone. One of them stares Eazy down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really wanna be here? This club is full of Pirus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We straight. Eazy LAUGHS, doesn't give a fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the tip, homie. The Security Guard frowns as he allows them into --

dialogues.speaker: THE MAIN FLOOR
dialogues.text: MUSIC PUMPING, we FOLLOW EAZY and REN into the CLUB, whic PACKED, people partying their asses off. Everyone's here:

dialogues.speaker: REGULAR FOLKS, BLOODS, SKINNY GIRLS, BIG GIRLS, DEALERS,
dialogues.text: ATHLETES. A true hood cross-section. AS WE MOVE through the place, we see CUBE, JINX and TYREE standing near the wall: JINX and TYREE are busy clocking GIRLS, but CUBE is studying a ripped-out page of LYRICS. ON STAGE, wearing purple satin jackets with WORLD CLASS WRECKIN CRU on the back, DRE spins some `80s R&B whil boy, YELLA, leans down, hollers at a GIRL in the crowd. Dre spots someone moving through the mass of people --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Yella, man -- Lonzo comin'! Yella quickly moves to the record crate, starts sifting through them to look like he's busy as -- LONZO WILLIAMS, club PROMOTER and Dre's BOSS approaches. leans over to Dre:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna make sure nothin's poppin' off outside. Keep them fat asses shakin'. None of that rap bullshit, you hear? I want people thinkin' `bout pussy not pistols. (then) And Yella, I saw you talkin to my lady. Keep your fuckin hands to yourself. Lonzo shoots Yella a look, then disappears from the stage

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you fuckin with that nigga's girl, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? Dre chuckles, immediately searches the crowd, locking eye with CUBE. Dre gives him a NOD, and Cube takes a breath, heads toward the Stage -- Moment of truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE BACK, EAZY and REN are surrounded by ladies. But Eazy's attention is clearly -- ON STAGE. Cube appears next to Dre, who's cuing up a new record. He stops the music, grabs the mic:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Compton! I got my homie -- he's about to get his rhyme on for y'all! Give it up for Ice muthafuckin' Cube! Dre hands the mic to Cube as the crowd eyeballs him with suspicion and restraint. They're clearly not gonna give h respect til he earns it. Cube steels himself, clenches hi jaw, puffs out his chest. And time turns eternal before - DRE drops the needle on Steve Arrington's funked-out WEAK THE KNEES (hardcore NWA fans will recognize this track as original sample for GANGSTA GANGSTA). Cube starts rapping, his voice powerful, thick with attit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's a little somethin' about a nigga like me. Never shoulda been let out the penitentiary. Ice Cube would like to say, That I'm a crazy muthafucka from around the way. Since I was a youth, I smoked weed out, Now I'm the muthafucka that ya read about. Takin a life or two, that's what the hell I do. Don't like how I'm livin', well fuck you! After only a few lines, the crowd's CHEERING. HOLLERING. Dancing. An infectious vibe. And we DRIFT back to Eazy, standing with Ren, feeling the fuck out of this music, pensive look on his face. Somethi crystallizing as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yella spins a number for the crowd, who seem less energiz now that Cube's off stage. To the side, LONZO chews out D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm this close to firin' your monkey ass! You tryin' to start a riot up in here?! You know I don't want that hardcore shit played in my club, but I turn my back and you do that shit anyway..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just tryin' to keep you in business. Open your eyes. They went crazy to that shit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're up on that stage `cause I put you there. You're a bad ass DJ, I'll give you that, but you don't listen and I'm gettin' real tired of arguing all the time. You know it's plenty DJs out there who'll play what I want `em to play. Guys that don't bite the hand that feeds 'em. Now you take a backseat to that shit. He glares at Dre before taking leave. Dre watches him go, body coiled tight. Jaw clenched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't trip off him, homie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, Lonzo ain't got no vision. Dre nods, yeah-yeah, but his eyes have landed on EAZY acr the room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit -- Check out this nigga. Yo, take over for a minute. Yella nods, commands the decks. Watches as Dre heads to -

dialogues.speaker: A17 THE BACK OF THE CLUB
dialogues.text: EAZY's kicking it with REN, talking up several GIRLS. But when Eazy sees Dre approaching, he smoothly shoos them aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Dre, how you been doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What up, E? Been a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know. Out here on the grind -- Nice jacket. Dre looks down at the purple satin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the uniform. I make it work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember Ren from Kelly Park, right? Ren and Dre give each other a respectful nod. REN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wuddup, Dre. EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard you been spendin' a lot of time at your auntie's house. How's the couch life? DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fucked up. I'm too tall for that shit. Plus I got my woman and baby livin' there. It's hard. But everybody can't do what you do. EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but what I do is playin' out, fast. Muthafuckas are gettin' locked up and laid down out here left and right. Time to make a few changes. DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Change ain't bad. Shit, I'm tryin' to make a few changes my self. EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you mean? Dre pauses, considering how to proceed... DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, you should think about dumpin' some money into this music shit. I got some ideas -- YELLA (ON THE MIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo! Dre turns to find Yella up on stage in the DJ booth, mout "LONZO," as he points into the crowd. Dre follows Yella's finger, spots Lonzo slowly moving through, greeting peopl he goes. DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit I gotta get back up there. Let's talk about this later. Think about it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eazy just smiles, nods, as Dre heads off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre exits the club, usual crate of records in hand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I know you!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!? Dre turns to find -- TYREE, all up in the face of some DUDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nigga, you heard me! Tyree shoves the dude -- Dre's eyes light up! That's my brother! He drops his crate of records, bumrushes the Dud and COLD-COCKS HIM. The Dude just drops, dazed. Dre turns to Tyree, adrenaline pumping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What he do!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muthafucka over here lookin' at me like he know me! Dre can't believe it -- That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyree, you gotta stop doin' this shit, man! The down Dude slowly gets onto his knees, stumbles to his feet just as -- WHOOP! WHOOP! An L.A. Sheriff's Dept. SQUAD CAR rolls int the lot, lights on Dre, Tyree and the Dude. In a hurry, t two OFFICERS are out of the car, approaching the guys --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We told everybody to clear this parking lot! What's going on!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got this, Officer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ask you what you got! Get the fuck home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am home. Officer 1 gets right in Dre's face, nose to nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't start walking -- But Dre just stands his ground, head cocked to the side, defying the Officer. In a flash -- BAM! Dre finds his face planted into the hood of the squa car! Cuffs slapped on! Same for Tyree and the Dude as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRE emerges from the Police Station, police property bag hand, to find EAZY waiting for him beside a fresh `63 IMP LOWRIDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got you for carrying records? That's some gangsta shit, Dre. Dre smiles, chuckles -- He's clearly beyond exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops will throw a nigga in jail for anything. At Eazy's car, Dre and Eazy pound hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lonzo just left you here, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess he's sick of bailing my ass out. Dre kneels down on the pavement, takes his shoelaces from police property bag and casually starts lacing his sneake But Eazy clocks a couple POLICE OFFICERS eyeballing him a Dre. Clearly, he's not comfortable here. Hops into the ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind gettin' your funny lookin' ass in the car before they arrest you for some other dumb shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eazy gestures like, we in front of the police station! Dr realizes. My bad. Hops in. Keeps lacing his sneakers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I was thinkin' about what you said last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's interestin' --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interestin'? Tell me this, how long you think that shit you doin' gonna last, huh? You ever heard of a happy ending in that game?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, man, this all comin' from the nigga I just bailed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, if you can slang dope, you can slang records. You got a mind for this shit, E.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay so what then -- That nigga last night? Is that what we doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, Cube? Nah, he in a group right now, got some other business goin' on. But I got this group called H.B.O. from the east coast. Dope voices, and Cube wrote a song for `em that's crazy. Eazy considers for a long moment as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre sits in front of a huge MIXING BOARD, adjusting the levels on a hard-driving BEAT. A small CREW of Kangol-wearing RAPPERS (HOME BOYS ONLY, a HBO) are gathered around, reading pages we recognize as CUBE'S LYRICS with befuddled expressions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is "Gankin"? And what's a "6-4"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUBE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a car. A `64 Impala. Everyone turns to look at CUBE, off to the side, annoyed. CUBE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gankin's when somebody jacks you. Ain't a big deal. Just sounds better that way. Another HBO dude chimes in -- HBO 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno, too much cussin' to get radio play. And honestly, nobody gives a fuck about Compton -- Dre interrupts from the board, no back down in him. DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all got somethin' to say about Compton? Cause we might have a problem up in this bitch. Nobody says a thing. Deafening silence. Then: DRE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then do the lyrics. We losin' time and I'm losin' patience. The vibe is tense, unpleasant. Finally: HBO 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't us. I ain't fuckin' with this Jheri curl bullshit -- CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you then. Wearing a Kangol don't make you L.L. Cool J nigga, remember that. HBO 1 CRUMPLES the Lyrics sheet into a ball. HBO 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Now what? CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you wanna do, mark ass nigga? Cube and the HBO dudes square up, swelling and huffing -- Without hesitation, Eazy gets up, stands beside Cube. Dre whips off his headphones and flanks Cube from the other s These dudes have each other's back, ready to throw down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HBO clowns start exiting, talking shit. Eazy wanders back over to the couch, plops down, sighs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well there goes the talent. Don't know a whole lot about the music game, but we can't start a label without talent. The three of them chuckle. Eazy sighs, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I put up my money -- I held up my side of the deal, Dre. When you gonna deliver your side?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well shit, why don't you get on the mic and try it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Fool, I ain't no rapper. Off Eazy's unsure look --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You already spent the money. Don't you get it? Man, this song is all about you! This song is about Eazy-muthafuckin'-E! Now get in the booth. Let me deliver my side of this shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON EAZY, self-conscious in the booth, light beaming on hi Dre gets up from the board, DIMS THE LIGHTS way down low

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just lemme produce. Get comfortable, man. Eazy takes a breath, huddles over the mic. He puts his Lo sunglasses on, pulls his baseball cap low -- so low you c barely see him (which is exactly the point). Dre sits behind the board with Cube. STARTS UP THE BEAT a cues Eazy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dry, flat) Cruisin' down the street in my 6-4 -
Cube winces. Dre STOPS the track. DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit that first beat hard. CRUISE-in down the street. CRUISE-in. When Eazy tries it again, it almost sounds worse -- EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cruisin' down the street in my 6-4 -
CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't it... EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get that dry-ass Jheri curl outta here, maybe I can concentrate. CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kickin' me out? Dre looks at Cube. Nods. Go. CUBE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aiight. I'm just sayin'... Cube exits. Then -- DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just gimme the words. EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nigga what? DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say that shit with me -- CRUISE-in -
EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (animated) Dre, you know this shit is hopeless, right? DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That! See how you just said that shit? Like you believe it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Cause I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So say this shit like you believe it. Like it's muthafuckin' Sunday and you cruisin' down the street in that dope-ass 6-4. Feel that shit, like its ya own words. The frustration on Eazy's face is apparent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really gonna make me do this, huh? Yup. Eazy frowns. Takes a moment to compose himself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aiight, fuck it. Let's do this. Dre starts the track again -- ONLY THIS TIME, HE DOES SO

dialogues.speaker: COMPONENT. AT A TIME. BUILDING THE SONG AS IF FROM SCRATC
dialogues.text: EAZY vibes with it. Can't fuckin' help it. Shit is dope. Finally, once THE BEAT IS FULLY REALIZED, Dre CUES him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cruisin' down the street in my 6-4. Dre grins. Much better. Stops the track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yeah! That shit was tight. Only 59 more lines, E. But we gonna get through it. Hit that next line -
Eazy groans, pulls his hat even lower, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a sense of ceremony here. Cube, Eazy, YELLA, REN, Jinx, DOC and few girls wait with palpable anticipation a DRE PUSHES PLAY on the freshly completed TRACK. It starts THUMPING from the speakers: It's BOYZ N THA HOOD. Pride and a sense of purpose swell in each and every one them as LONZO POPS IN. Listens, skeptical. The song stops and no one says a word. They know this is something special. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lonzo, what you think? LONZO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That some waste of time shit right there and trust me, it ain't gonna work. Won't get no radio play. DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never know-- We might do a radio version and take it up to KDAY and see what happens. LONZO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This reality rap is never going to work, Dre. You need to hurry up and rap this shit up and finish that slow jam I had you working on. I'm serious, Dre! Hurry up with this... DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, I don't know about working on this slow stuff anymore. After this I'm going to work on songs with DOC. Reveal DOC in the background. LONZO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a request, Dre. Lonzo scowls at Dre, exits in a huff. Yella goes to Dre, wide with excitement -- DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, if Lonzo don't like it, you know that shit is dope. They pound. Everyone LAUGHS. Truth. REN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, Dre -- You just turned a hustler into a rapper. EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now this right here..? This some ruthless shit for real. Dre, you a muthafuckin' genius. And Cube, you got more of them stories to tell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homie, I got rhymes for days. But I got to hear this one more gen...Dre, hit that shit. Laughter as Dre cues it up, the SONG RESUMING, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOYZ IN THA HOOD is PLAYING OVER -- A STACK of VINYL RECORDS moves through a PRESS. A machine STAMPS a RED LABEL onto the MIDDLE. CLOSE ON the RED RUTH LABEL -- BOYZ N THA HOOD. IN THE RECEIVING AREA, EAZY picks up a couple BOXES of RECORDS. He PAYS for them, and hauls them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOYZ keeps on THUMPING -- DRE and TYREE stand at the counter of a RECORD STORE, wit BOX OF RECORDS. The CLERK takes about SIX RECORDS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOYZ continues OVER -- Eazy emerges from a RUN-DOWN HOUSE, jogs across the stree his BUCKET, climbs inside, opens his STASH SPOT, stuffs a large WAD of CASH inside. A hustler is always hustlin --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some local TEENAGERS are partying, drinking and listening BOYZ N THE HOOD wax. And that shit has the party bumpin'. A sense that this song is going VIRAL, in a contagious, p internet sort of way --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOYZ continues as Eazy brings TWO BOXES of RECORDS to a S MEET BOOTH operated by STEVE YANO. Yano excitedly collect the two boxes, hands over some cash. Deal done. Before Ea can even bounce, some KIDS bumrush Yano for copies --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOYZ slowly fades, iconic KDAY Disc Jockey GREG MACK spin the TRACK over the airwaves of Los Angeles. He grins, bob his head, digging this shit for real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1580 KDAY, this is Greg Mack -- Mack Attack. That was "Boyz n tha Hood" by Eazy-E, local rapper out of Compton. Sounds like he's about 15 years old -- He glances over to the TELEPHONE SWITCHBOARD, which sudde LIGHTS UP like crazy, with dozens of CALLERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I know you like it. It's been the most requested record on this station ever since I played it. The freshest song of 1986 --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eazy pays for another couple boxes of records. Grabs them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard your record. Eazy turns to find -- JERRY HELLER, a middle-aged guy in a velvet track suit. H face is craggy, seasoned, wise. He's got terrible posture but lively, hyper-alert eyes. He extends his hand to Eazy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry Heller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric Wright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleasure to meet you. Would it be possible to have a word with you, Eric?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry at his desk, Eazy on the ratty couch. Eazy lets his eyes wander around the shabby office. The sad furniture, old and irrelevant posters on the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought your record was good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just good? Why you call me in here then -- Eazy gets up and heads for the door -- JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-no-no, hang on. (beat) I thought it was exceptional. Please, sit back down. Eazy indulges Jerry. Sits back down and stares, cold, unreadable. Jerry rubs his eyes, frustrated, his regular spiel isn't having its usual effect. JERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's try this again. As a music manager, let me tell you what I can do for you, Eric -- EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'm the one who can do somethin' for you. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think because I don't have some flashy office, that means I don't know what I'm talking about? Elton John, War, Styx, REO Speedwagon -- EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You manage anybody this decade? Jerry leans on his elbows on the desk, cocks his head at Eazy. The balls on this kid. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you what I see. Lotta raw talent. Lotta braggadoccio. But if you think anyone's gonna talk to you, if you think anyone's gonna let you into the building where you might talk to somebody -- somebody who matters -- you're crazy. Eazy frowns, looks away -- JERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I do for you. I will make you legit. I will take you into that building. I will protect you. I will block out all the noise of this business and we can build something big. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're gonna have to believe in me like I believe in you. If you don't think you can do that... Eazy doesn't budge. Satisfied, Jerry continues --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got more music for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got everything you need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, cause you're gonna have to follow this up. So what does N.W.A. stand for anyway? (with a smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Whites Allowed? Eazy looks at Jerry. Cold as ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Niggas With Attitudes." The smile is wiped off Jerry's face immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 200 or so people lined up outside, waiting to get in. NWA POSTERS are stapled to walls in testament to guerilla marketing. Notice the profusion of PEOPLE present as -- Eazy and Ren pull into the lot, exit the car and heads inside, intoxicated by the sea of people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eazy addresses the guys, all business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked everybody to wear something black today, `cause if we gonna be an All-Star group, we gotta look like an All-Star group. WE PULL BACK to reveal the GUYS -- Cube, Dre and Ren -- gathered around Eazy. A whole crew is there with them, to including DOC, Tyree and Jinx. And everybody's dressed in some type of BLACK L.A. RAIDERS GEAR, except Yella who approaches from the side wearing an old school purple &am L.A. KINGS jersey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn Yella! What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, kiss my ass, I ain't got no Raider gear.-- Are we gettin' paid to wear that shit? Eazy hits him in the face with a black t-shirt. EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put this on. As YELLA starts to change shirts, Jerry Heller comes arou the corner talking to the promoter, nothing hip-hop about at all. CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aww damn-- here come The White Shadow. (no smiles) REN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, Mr. Furley from "Three's Company." EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated) Man, shut the fuck up? This dude knows the game inside out. He been out there shopping our shit around. Gonna find distribution for Ruthless, get us on tour and bring a whole lot of money to the table. DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then what-- How he get paid? EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just takes 20::percent:: off the top. That's it. We cut up 80. That's how managers work. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drink in hand) All managers don't get 20 mothafuckin' percent! EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc, shut yo drunk ass up. You don't know the music business. DOC take another sip. Jerry joins the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JERRY HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey fellas, sorry I'm running late. I'll be honest. We've had a lot of passes. People are scared of you guys big time. They think you're dangerous. But I think that's a good thing. And we've had a couple nibbles, from a couple labels. Epic, Capitol, Priority... REN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Nibbles"..? What's that mean? Jerry pauses a beat, finding the best response. JERRY HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the thing. You guys can make a real record. Sell it nationwide. But we're not there yet. These labels, they're still gonna need some... convincing. So I invited a few of them to your show. So you have to kick ass tonight. Can you do that? The guys stare back at Jerry, with the fire in their eyes Goddamn right they can do it -- "Hell yeah!" JERRY HELLER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go and make sure they're all here. Jerry peels away and goes inside. Cube looks at Eazy. CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you trust this dude? Cause he looks like a one of my old muthafuckin' history teachers. Eazy cocks his head at Cube. EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You trust me? CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I trust you. But that ain't what we talking about -- EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just leave it up to me. I'll make sure everything is straight. Just have them raps cocked and loaded. Dre throws his arm around Eazy, puts a stop to it--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on now. Cube has never failed to deliver. He always comes correct, ready to work. That ain't gonna change. Aiight? Cube and Eazy soften, smile at each other, it's all good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can this muthafucka Jerry Heller bring in more pussy? That's worth 20 percent! Everyone LAUGHS as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the PACKED MASS of the CROWD, crammed together, ha in the air, SCREAMING, even though nothing's happened yet The stage is pitch black as we see the silhouettes of NWA members manning their battle stations. More screams and anticipation from the crowd. At the BACK of the room, we see JERRY HELLER beside THREE nervous-looking RECORD EXECS. One of them -- BRYAN TURNER glances around warily at the inner-city CROWD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure this is... safe for us..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try not to look so scared, Bryan. They smell it on ya, you're finished. Turner FREEZES and his eyes go wide -- Jerry LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: This is Eazy E and NWA. Guys, this is Bryan Turner. CUBE

dialogues.text: Dre runs his fingers on the knobs and levels of the mixin board. There's nowhere that he feels more at home. Eazy, Cube, Ren, Yella and Jerry are gather in the studio. Dre Inspired:

dialogues.text: Nah, you don't get it.

dialogues.text: But Eazy just grins, heads for the door. Opens it, PEEPS through the crack --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you lookin' for Felicia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIG DUDE is still out there, standing about 15 feet away, with TWO OTHER similarly-large DUDES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She in there or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she's in here. Problem is, my homeboy's got his dick in her mouth. Big Dude scowls, rests his hand on the butt of his pistol

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck did you say? BACK INSIDE, Ren overhears this. Tosses a GIRL off his la grabs his 9mm from the table, COCKS it -- IN THE HALLWAY, Eazy steps FULLY out of his room -- RACKS AK and AIMS IT RIGHT AT THE 3 DUDES --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How bad you want Felicia now? The DUDES gape at Eazy a moment, then SCATTER, disappeari down the hallway. Eazy LAUGHS his ass off as Ren bolts ou 9mm in hand, ready for anything --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where they go? But the coast is clear. Eazy keeps laughing. Heads back inside as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cube, Dre, Yella, Ren and D.O.C. stroll through, carrying bags of McDonalds. Cube's eyes drift over to the fancy FO STAR RESTAURANT across from the lobby where he can see Je and Eazy at a table inside, enjoying a lavish meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet y'all upstairs. Cube heads for the restaurant --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE BAR TV, NANCY REAGAN's concerned face fills the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANCY REAGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the sake of our children, I implore each of you to be unyielding and inflexible in your opposition to drugs. Our young people are helping us lead the way. Not long ago in Oakland, California, I was asked by a group of children what to do if they were offered drugs. And I answered, just say no. AT A TABLE NEARBY, Jerry and Eazy devour steaks and lobst sipping champagne. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned) Another one called-- said she was pregnant by you too. Eric, you gotta slow down. You can't fuck'em all... EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. (Deep breathe) All these chicks want is money. If I was broke, they're wouldn't even be calling. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well, you start making a little money, problems come with it. EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White people problems? JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money problems are race neutral. But I'll help you through all of it. I'll put you in touch with -- Jerry's distracted by the sight of Cube marching towards table, bag of McDonald's still in hand. Smiles up at him. Eazy doesn't make eye contact. JERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evening, Cube... CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the deal on them contracts, Jerry? I'm still waitin' on 'em...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, stop asking about them fuckin' contract. They're coming --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, Eric. Cube's right to ask, and I'm remiss in not updating you guys. (to Cube)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contracts are being finalized as we speak. Truth is, attorneys will bleed you dry going over `em. Wish I was paid by the hour...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah me too. I just like to know what's goin' on. Since I wrote a lot of lyrics on this record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody knows how important you are, Cube. Just give us a little more time. Cube glances at Eazy, who's like a statue. Cube picks up Eazy's champagne glass, drains it, sets it back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit's pretty good. Someday, huh? With that, he turns and walks out. Jerry watches him go. Then, to no one in particular:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to be you so freaking bad. This kid has issues. At some point, you gotta trust somebody... But Eazy's not paying attention. Waving to a passing wait

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiter! Another round over here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NWA tour bus blurs by, a prism of light and speed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cube and Dre speak in hushed tones, everyone else asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I think you over reacting. Eazy's one of us, Cube. What you thinking don't even make sense --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what don't make sense? Eazy chillin' with Jerry eatin' steak and lobster while we at Mickey D's. That shit don't make sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I hear that, but I think we should ride this wave. Don't be jumpin' to conclusions until you know for sure, WE HEAR a FAINT VIBRATING SOUND. Dre realizes it's his PA Grabs it off his bed. Sees that he's missed TWELVE PAGES. EVERY SINGLE ONE IS LABELED "9-1-1." Instinct in overdriv he hurries to the FRONT of the bus, tells the DRIVER --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta stop. Gotta get somewhere with a phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're in the middle of nowh --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop the fuckin' bus, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BUS is parked in a nearly-empty PARKING LOT outside o lonesome, isolated GAS STATION. It's a dark, starless nig Dre shuffles slowly out of the station, in a daze, like h just awoke from a fucked-up dream. He walks over to the B But instead of getting on, he SITS DOWN on the pavement, filled with shock and disbelief. The sound of FOOTSTEPS as Ren, Yella, Cube, and Eazy exit bus, surround Dre. They can tell something is very wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Dre. What's goin' on? ON DRE as he forces back the tears that wanna come, his v barely a whisper:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Moms called. Tyree. He's dead. Somebody killed my little brother... Shocked: "What?" "Hell naw!" "What happen?" are heard amo Cube, Eazy, Yella and Ren-- they crouch down next to Dre. sure what else to say or do. They wait for Dre to say mor DRE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got into a fight near Leimert Park. A big mothafucka fell on top of him -- broke his neck. He killed Tyree. I can't believe this shit. Face buried in his hands, Dre quietly weeps. Jinx, Laylaw and DJ Speed gather in the front window of t bus. Not wanting to interrupt the group's moment. Cube rests a hand on Dre's shoulder as the others tighten circle. There's silence... until: CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never told y'all, but when I was twelve, my sister got murdered by her own husband-- A fuckin' wanna be cop who couldn't make it in the academy. Life changed for me that day. Everything became serious-- EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dope game took my cousin's life. I remember when they found him. DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoulda been out here with me. If he was out here-- It never woulda happened... REN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or it could've happened in another way. Can't blame yourself, Dre... Life has to end for all of us, but love don't. Feel me? Tyree is always gonna be with you. No matter what. Eazy moves closer. Slowly, he places a hand on Dre's head Rubs it. It's a bit startling -- Eazy's not one for tenderness. But it's clear he feels Dre's pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna be aiight, Dre... We with you. PULL BACK as the guys remain clustered around Dre. Lookin small, so vulnerable, crouched in front of the Bus, alone the parking lot. NWA against the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a suit, Dre stands beside Tyree's MEMORIAL WALL, his a draped around his heartbroken mother, Verna. She cries without end or apology, surrounded by family, including h other brother, WARREN G, plus Eazy, Cube, Ren and Yella. It's solemn and quiet. Dre remains stoic, staring hard, trying his best to remain strong for his mother. All memb of the band keep a close eye on him, as the pastor wraps his eulogy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death is a threshold we all have to pass through. No one is exempt. Tyree will set a place for us on the other side and we will see him again. The flesh will always return to the earth. But our spirits will live on forever. Amen! The congregation repeats the pastor with a follow up "Ame

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shattered Dre slumps out with his mom, Verna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I brung him out on tour with me, like he wanted --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not on you, Andre. Dre doesn't say anything. Keeps his head bowed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We was supposed to kick it... Next chance I got --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not your fault. Understand me? Stop this nonsense. Stop it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at his momma. This strong woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother looked up to you. And you took great care of him. We both did. It's time to let someone else take care of him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, she can no longer hold back the tears. Dre hug her, mother and son comforting each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm proud of you... So proud of you, baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre fights back tears of his own, the words he's longed t hear. As Verna slowly turns and walks away, Cube, Eazy, R and Yella surround him, brothers in arms. They walk out t Mausoleum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 55pt1   -- Rural farmland. Flyover-ville. Where the fuck 55pt2   -- Dre stares out the window, despondent, lost in 55pt3   INT./EXT. TOUR BUS -- Cube and Ren jot lyrics on notepads as the bus passes more PROTESTORS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check this out --

dialogues.speaker: PROTESTOR 1 PROTESTOR 2 PROTESTOR 3
dialogues.text: Ban gangsta rap!     Get the hell out   NWA is filth! of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUD! An egg smacks into the window OBSCURING OUR VIEW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should get out and beat his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 55pt4   INT. TOUR BUS -- Yella watches porn next to Eazy who's grown bored...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man shut that off. Put on my shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disgruntled, Yella obliges. Puts on SCARFACE. Eazy smiles 55pt5   INT. TOUR BUS -- Eazy and Jerry mastermind backstage at a concert. Jerr HANDS a BILLBOARD MAGAZINE to Eazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving up on the Billboard 200 albums chart, Holding our bullet the R&B, Hip-Hop chart. I mean, you have any idea how many records we're selling? Ruthless has arrived. Eric, we are huge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eazy scans the magazine. Drinks it in, sly smile as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surrounded by GROUPIES, living the life, the GANG hangs b the pool. Odd looks are sent their way from snobby HOTEL GUESTS, a school of fish out of water as -- JERRY looks worried as he makes a bee-line toward the poo his trademark velvet sweat suit, LETTER in hand. He officiously hands it to Eazy, who scans it. Growls:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The muthafuckin' FBI?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These words catch everybody's attention. We catch a GLIMP OF THE LETTER on FBI stationary -- Dre snatches it from E

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, they comin' after us, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Cube leans over -- reads aloud:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... advocating violence and assault is wrong and we in the law enforcement community take exception to such action." Have they ever heard of freedom of speech? What the fuck can they do to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a warning. A message to our record label about "Fuck the Police". We should really think about not performing that song for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't sit well with the group. Moans and growns ar heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over their PROTESTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax. RELAX. No need to worry-- All I'm saying is, we should be aware of this threat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it was from the LAPD, then I'd be worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should all be happy, not worried. This is a gift, man. More free publicity for NWA. (waves letter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why we gonna send this to the press. Let everybody know about this kind of harassment and intimidation by the government. Right, Jerry? Jerry does not think this is the best idea ever but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, uh. If that's what you wanna do, then maybe we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it, Jerry. Let everybody see this bullshit. Eazy gives the letter back to Jerry, who walks off, leavi the boys all hanging pool side. After a deliberative beat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess freedom of speech don't mean shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if you a nigga wit an attitude. All they guys look at each other. Eazy ain't worried abou nothing-- he puts on his Locs and continues to kick it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of different POLICE OFFICERS from DIFFERENT CITIES across U.S., each reciting their city's obscenity ordinance, one line bleeding into the next: A57pt1 -- A Macon, GA OFFICER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No person shall disturb the peace by -- A57pt2 -- A Montgomery, AL OFFICER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Participating or abetting in any rude, indecent, riotous, drunken or violent conduct -- A57pt3 -- A Louisville, KY OFFICER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Using any vulgar, obscene or abusive language in a public place -
A57pt4 -- A St. Louis, MO OFFICER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Inciting any other person to commit any breach of the peace, or --

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: We catch a serious and quiet Cube along with the rest of - and Jerry Heller -- gathered as a local POLICE OFFICER reads to them from a piece of PAPER -- Eazy has on his sk mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- committing any obscene, indecent or immoral act in a public place. Note also that performance of the song "F The Police" will not be permitted. Refusal to abide by all Detroit City Ordinances will result in immediate arrest and forfeiture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we finished, man? We got a show to do. The Cop sneers at Cube, walks off, throws another shot --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just watch yourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-- You watch yourselves too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares back at Ren one more time -- before leaving. Eazy takes off his hockey mask. All the GUYS are looking each other. Eazy and Jerry head off across the room for a private chat -- Ren looks at Cube -- Cube looks at Dre -- Yella looks at perfect ass of a passing FEMALE OFFICER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah man, fuck the po-lice for real. He laughs and sticks his tongue out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Dre spinning, Cube, Ren and Yella hype the crowd as tears up the final bars of STRAIGHT OUTTA COMPTON --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the auto-biography of the E, and if you ever fuck with me you'll get taken, by a stupid dope brotha who will smother, word to the motherfucka, straight outta Compton. The CROWD goes insane as the CHORUS PLAYS OUT. Like a God Eazy pimp strides off stage where Jerry awaits, all smile arms open as -- BACK ON STAGE, Cube, Dre, Yella and Ren are feeling defia CUBE addresses the amped CROWD:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo hold up, hold up -- Y'all know what the muthafuckin' po-lice just told us back stage? They tired to tell us-- what the fuck we can't say-- what the fuck we can't play! The CROWD HOLLERS and BOOS their disapproval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put ya middle finger in the air! Cube raises his hand in the air, quickly SNAPS HIS MIDDLE FINGER to attention. Ren does the same with BOTH HANDS -- The CROWD RESPONDS by getting LOUDER THAN WE'VE EVER HEAR and RETURNING the gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're talking THOUSANDS of people, all with BOTH MIDDLE FINGERS RAISED -- this is the real shit, this is what the came here for -- CUBE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This NWA -- We do what the fuck we wanna do! We say what the fuck we wanna say! So, all I wanna tell that cop talking shit back stage is -- Yo Dre, I got something to say! Dre DROPS IT. Cube jumps right into it, pure adrenaline - CUBE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: GOT IT BAD CAUSE I'M BROWN --
dialogues.text: The crowd goes ape-shit! BOUNCING and THRASHING like a MO PIT. Pure ELECTRICITY-- Jerry Heller is suddenly alarmed by the song selection. As Cube slices throughout the first verse -- Cops are getting agitated -- Waiting for the order to pou After their CAPTAIN has seen enough-- He gives the order. At that moment, the PLAINCLOTHES COPS in the crowd pull o their BADGES and start MOVING FORWARD through the sea of people, trying to make their way to the STAGE -- Cube keeps SPITTING -- lyrics are approaching that mighty hook. The UNDERCOVER COPS are causing a lot of commotion in the crowd... When CUBE hits the hook the CROWD JOINS IN, beca they know all the lyrics -- CUBE & CROWD

dialogues.speaker: POLICE
dialogues.text: POP-POP-POP -- Cube stops rapping -- the CROWD is momenta STUNNED! What the hell was THAT? Gunfire? A fucking BOMB? Whatever it was, TOTAL CHAOS BREAKS OUT -- The CROWD starts SURGING for the EXITS. Suddenly, DOZENS COPS have MATERIALIZED OUT OF NOWHERE -- All the members of NWA DROP their mics and rush off stage while the Arena descends into mayhem behind them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's CHAOTIC. Tons of COPS, both UNIFORMED and UNDERCOVER SWARM as the Guys RACE past a LIVID Eazy and Jerry --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck did you DO!? No time for answers, THEY RUN TOO. Jerry can't believe th cops are on their tails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the GUYS try to make their way to an idling VAN which waiting to whisk them away to safety, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw fuck... Because they all just noticed TWO THINGS: 1) there are DO of rabid FANS gathered outside, and 2) there are also A S LOAD OF POLICE, holding back the FANS. The GROUP is spott by some COPS, who peel off and head STRAIGHT FOR THEM --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go y'all... The COPS are immediately ON them, grabbing, frisking, CUFFING, and DRAGGING them all toward a PADDY WAGON which materialized outside. And as soon as the CROWD sees their beloved NWA being hau away, they go NUTS, and start throwing BOTTLES and ROCKS the COPS, who DUCK and SWERVE to avoid the projectiles. The CROWD starts CHANTING, at a deafening volume --

dialogues.speaker: FUCK THE POLICE. FUCK THE POLICE --
dialogues.text: Before it gets any hairier, the COPS start PILING NWA int the PADDY WAGON. JERRY HELLER tries to shove his way over

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no right! This is illegal! You can't do this -- But the Detroit Cops don't give a shit, they SLAM Jerry u against a wall, hold him there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay fucking put, old man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry watches helplessly as the Paddy Wagon PEELS AWAY in the night, taking our heroes away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus cruises along as we PUSH INSIDE to the sound of -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence, save the rumble of the road. Everyone sits by himself, semi-secluded. Nobody talks. They all just stare the windows, embroiled in thought. Exhausted. Shell-shock Jerry watches a NEWS REPORT on the riot at the Detroit sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck were you guys thinking? They can hold us libel for inciting a riot! No one cares that the police started it... Dre, Ren and Yella start paying attention as Eazy switche channels. Finds another report about the riot. And anothe And another. Images blurring by of the concert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whether you like it or not, you are a political group. Never give these assholes a reason to hurt you. Next time they might take it. The guys watch, realizing that they're becoming a part of zeitgeist. No longer in the news, they are the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The explosive Compton rap group,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- aka Niggers With Attitudes, officially had their video banned here at MTV due to gang-like images that could incite violence. This is not the first scrape with controversy for the band --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK! CLICK! CLICK! NWA sit at a long table being interviewed for a PRESS JUNKET, dozens of microphones thr in their faces, cameras flashing. All the members are engaged, leaning forward, elbows on the table. They got e other's back as WE PARACHUTE IN:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you explain insighting a riot in Detroit? What do you have to say about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't insight shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just got a snapshot of how Americans honestly feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't create that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your songs glamorize the lifestyle of gangs, guns and drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My art is the reflection of my reality. What do you see when you go outside of your door. I know what i see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it ain't glamorous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And by the way, the hood gets AKs from Russia and cocaine from Columbia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't even have passports. Check the source.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is responsible for that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are experiencing a metoric rise. How can you explain that artits like Axl Rose from Guns and Roses are wearing your tshirts and hats?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it obvious. Real recongnize real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE must of struck a nerve. Journalist 4 quickly interjects -- The guys let that lie a moment as other JOURNALISTS speak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you be more careful about what you say, and how you say it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. Everyone LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell no. Last I heard, this is America and we got Freedom of Speech. Pretty sure that includes rap music. Exercisin' our Free Speech across this whole damn country, openin' people's eyes. Far as I'm concerned that's our job. The Journalists take that in, impressed by Cube's media s and forthright demeanor. Cube points to another JOURNALIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Cube, what's a guy from Compton do when he starts making real money like this? Laughter from the assembled. Not from Cube. Silence. Then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cube..?

dialogues.speaker: NI
dialogues.text: The typical cookie-cutter hotel blights the beautiful des landscape as the band exits the tour bus, enters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUBE walks down the hotel hallway, stops in front of a do He KNOCKS, but there's no answer. He notices the door is PROPPED open with the dead-bolt, so he pushes inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cube enters the dark room. At the far end of the room, there's a DESK, with a lone LAMP illuminated, casting wei creepy shadows across the room. And JERRY HELLER sits behind the desk, his face mostly obscured in shadow. Cube grins, bemused, because this tab is clearly deliberate, a dramatic show of power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nice to see you, Cube.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I can barely see you, Jerry. What's with all this Godfather shit? Jerry ignores the comment, rises from behind the desk, carefully places a stapled sheaf of PAPERS on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you've been very eager to sign a contract with Eric's company, Ruthless Records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your company too, right? You and Eric. All for one, one for all. Jerry sighs, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's incorrect. It's not my company. I work for you. I've made that clear from the beginning. Cube just nods, like, yeah right. Picks up the thick contract, pages through it. It's full of dense legalese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, cool. So I can take this one, show it to a lawyer or somethin'? Jerry stares at him for a beat. Places his hands on the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cube, lawyers get paid to make trouble. That's what they do -- create problems where problems don't exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have no idea what it says. At least let me take it to show my family. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can assure you, it's all standard. You can read it now, if you like. Cube's expression darkens. He clenches his jaw. CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry, you know I can't understand this legal shit. None of us can. That's why we need to show it to a lawyer-- JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cube, I thought you knew? Everyone else signed already. You're the only one who hasn't. Cube flips to the last page. The Signatory page. Sure eno there's EAZY's signature, DRE's, YELLA's, and REN's. Cube only shake his head with confusion, disappointment. CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck..? JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
