dialogues.text: Look. Cube. This is a great thing. This is what you always wanted your whole life. And there's also this. Jerry lays a CHECK on the desk in front of Cube, made out O'SHEA JACKSON. And it's for $75,000. Cube can't help it, eyes go wide. It's more money than he ever dreamed of. CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. (beat) Thanks, man. He reaches for the check, but Jerry pulls it back. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon as you sign this contract, the money is all yours. Cube freezes. Realizes he's being shaken down. CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my money anyway, Jerry. I earned it. I wrote a lot of hit songs. I been on tour for months. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Performing. Gettin' arrested and shit. And you gonna try to gank me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me my money, Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding me, right? Who do you think pays for everything? All the hotel rooms, the parties, the transpo? You think that's free? Cube closes his eyes. Takes a deep breath. He must litera will himself to not implant his fist in Jerry's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why all this now,   Jerry? Back in the beginning, if   you thought we were so good, why   didn't you just give us contracts   then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's a sure thing, Cube. Even a great talent can crash and burn. Too much ego, too much excess, too many expectations -- it tends to ruin things. You oughta keep that in mind. Cube stares hard. Knows exactly what Jerry's implying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna ask one more time. Are you sayin' I can't have the money I earned, unless I sign this contract, right now, without showin' it to anybody? Jerry just crosses his arms, looks at Cube, says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Jerry. He turns and walks out of the room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre, Ren and Yella lounge on the lobby couch, packed bags beside them. And they couldn't be happier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'mma get me a El Camino with some gold Daytons and a Phantom top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't wait to get out of that "po- man's Porsche" and get me some real shit -- Face crumpled with anger, Cube approaches. Drops his bags

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all signed that Ruthless contract without a lawyer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah -- And we got paaaaaid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For $75,000 dollars, I don't give a fuck what's in that contract! Dre and Ren chuckle at Yella's candor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't signed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell naw I ain't signin' that bullshit. Don't y'all think it's a little fucked up that Jerry won't let us show it to nobody? That seem honest to y'all? If he offered us seventy-five thousand, he probably owes us double that. (to Ren)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought we talked about this, dude?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is what it is... I don't trust Jerry but I trust Eric. Cube's disgusted by their ignorance. Only Dre seems to be considering Cube's words --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this point, Eric and Jerry in this thing together. Believe dat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus is parked back where the tour began. Exhausted, D.O.C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: exits the bus and heads toward a BURGUNDY CHEVY BLAZER, w SUGE KNIGHT waits to pick him up. D.O.C. throws his bags the back. Kicks it with Suge for a minute as -- Eazy exits the bus with Yella. They watch D.O.C. and Suge EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What up with Doc and Suge? YELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess that dude's "managing" him now. One day you Bobby Brown's bodyguard, next day you reppin' talent. Everybody wanna get into the act... Dre exits, looking discouraged. And we understand why whe equally despondent Cube exits the bus and begins to move from the crew. Dre catches up to him -- DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo Cube-- You can't just sign that shit, homie..? Keep making history..? CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw man, not like this. I'd rather be broke then get fucked -- Why did you sign that shit, Dre? DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nigga, I got bills to pay -- and I need to put some money in my Momma's hands after Tyree passed. CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, I get it. Everybody gotta do what they gotta do. They're gonna take care you. You they're bread and butter. DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cube, we Ruthless. CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, we NWA. They Ruthless. T-BONE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You comin', Cube? Cube turns to find T-BONE from the Lench Mob and Jinx, waiting for him in his CAR. He looks back at Dre -- I'm o They pound hug and Cube heads off. Hops into T-Bone's rid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK WITH DRE, considering the scene as everyone drives a going in separate directions: Cube leaves with T-Bone... Yella leaves with Ren... Eazy leaves with Jerry... And D.O.C. leaves with Suge... Dre finds himself all alone, confronting a new reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cube rides in the passenger seat, pretty low at this poin No money, no group. JINX MOUTH IS RUNNING, but Cube's in daze -- doesn't hear a word he's saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't believe you left the group, man. What you gonna do now? Guess we gotta start working on some solo stuff, huh? Cube? Cube?! As the car pulls up to a stop light, Cube looks over, spo beautiful YOUNG LADY in a nice jeep on rims. She's looks over at him, their eyes locked. Is this love at first sig After a few magical moments. Cube finally speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing? My name O'Shea. What's yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Kim-- You the best thing I've seen all day. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You believe in love at first sight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you think? She is the only one that can get Cube to smile at this po

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cube, Kim by his side, is seated opposite Bryan Turner -- who's floored by the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, you're really leaving the group... CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm tired of the games. Eazy puts everything on Jerry and Jerry puts everything on Eazy. They can have it. BRYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you feel about that Kim? Is he making a big mistake? KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so-- after hearing everything that happened, I would've left too. Now he has the chance to showcase all his talents. BRYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I believe in you Cube, so I'll tell ya what: there's not a lot of money in this right now, but if this first record hits, I'll make it up to you on the next one. Cube gets up and shakes Bryan's hand. CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well get ready--   `cause these albums are gonna   be comin' real fast. I'm hungry   and I got a lot to say that's gonna   fuck the world up. BRYAN TURNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who're you gonna get to produce? Ruthless is probably gonna veto Dre working on the project. So what's your plan? CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I can't get the best producer in the in the west. I gotta go get the best in the east. Off Cube's determined look--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUBE, rocking a LENCH MOB JACKET, spitting new lyrics int the mic with crazy energy, a stack of notebooks on the ch beside him. It's the creation of NIGGA YA LOVE TO HATE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kickin' shit called street knowledge. Why more niggas in the pen than in college? Now cause of that line I might be your cellmate. That's from the nigga ya love to hate. IN THE MIXING BOOTH: CHUCK D -- Pittsburgh Pirates hat, b low, PUBLIC ENEMY on his jacket -- along with the SHOCKLE JINX and DA LENCH MOB plus 2 members of the FRUIT OF ISLA Security and KIM. Everyone exchanging looks, impressed. ON A SUSPENDED TV in the corner, we see LOUIS FARRAKHAN preaching to a crowd of F.O.I. It's clear this is a very different world than the one Cube left behind in L.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The completed version of NIGGA YA LOVE TO HATE POUNDS out the SPEAKERS in DRE's ride as he pulls up to Eazy's crib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (FUCK YOU ICE CUBE!) Yeah, HA-HA! I'm the nigga ya love to hate -- Dre chuckles to himself in disbelief. Shit is dope. On th SEAT beside him, a CD with the plastic freshly torn off - It's Ice Cube's AMERIKKKA'S MOST WANTED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a PARTY going on at Eazy's huge new mansion, reminiscent of Scarface's estate. And the gang's all here everyone we know... except for Cube. Over by the poolside gazebo, JERRY talks with a troubled EAZY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cube's record's in the Billboard top 20! Our shit never even came close to that. He's blowin' the fuck up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be fine, Eric. It's not just NWA anymore, it's our whole Ruthless roster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got D.O.C., we've got Michel'le, we've got Above the Law. We're moving up to the next level. EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta keep Dre happy. Keep him motivated. Eazy looks over at DRE, across the pool -- He's DANCING w three drop-dead BEAUTIFUL GIRLS. Dre's smile is massive. clearly loves this sweet life. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at him. You think he needs anymore motivation than that? EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah I get it. He drownin' in pussy. But that don't mean -- JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta stop worrying so much. Let me do the worrying for you. Fact is, Ren can write just as good as Cube. Maybe even better. Come over here a minute -- Eazy follows Jerry to a TABLE where he's set up a bunch o CHECKS and PAPERS, and he hands Eazy a PEN. JERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need your autograph on these checks and a few other things. Just sign right here -- Eazy starts SIGNING, even though his eyes keep drifting o to the many WOMEN partying. Jerry GRINS, noticing how qui Eazy gets distracted. EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We done with this shit now? JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're done. EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Jerry. I'mma go fuck now. Jerry laughs, slaps Eazy on the back as he walks off, and stands there enjoying the sunshine, the pretty girls, the party vibe. His eyes wander to the PORCH, where --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUGE KNIGHT is standing, smoking a cigar. And Suge is STA at Jerry, his expression blank. Almost like he's studying Jerry. The old man stops smiling, deeply unsettled. Lucki DRE APPROACHES SUGE, breaking the big dawg's gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wuddup, Suge -- You good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you? Off Dre's confused look --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just figured you might be a bit fucked up after hearin' Cube's shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucked up about what? I been bangin' that shit. D.O.C. Interrupts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wuddup, Dre. There's some bitches up in here, right? (to Suge) Yo, you take care of that shit for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on it. Dre takes notice of the exchange as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cube is standing in Bryan Turner's office, and we can tel right off, things are tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just tellin' you what you told me. If Amerikkka's Most blew up, you'd advance me for the follow-up. That's what you said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's more complicated than that, Cube, there's metrics --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Bryan. I don't even know what that means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I got a kid on the way -- and I just bought a house on the strength of what you told me. You gave me your word. Bryan stands up, holds his hands out, tries to soothe --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cube. Relax. We're on the same team here. I'm your biggest fan --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like this shit keeps happenin' to me, no matter what I do. When people do the work, they should get paid. Why you making it seem like I'm begging for some shit that's technically mine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course your not begging -- and I'm not trying to be difficult. Cube glances around at all the GOLD and PLATINUM records adorning the walls in Bryan's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you can't help me. That's what you're sayin'. Bryan puts his hands in his pockets, hangs his head. The answer is obvious. Cube stares at him a beat, then turns back, heads out the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cube, wait, Cube, come back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan's still in his office, grinding through some work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoulda kept your word, Bryan. CUBE and THE LENCH MOB (same dudes we saw at Greene Stree enter, Cube holding a METAL BASEBALL BAT! IN A FLASH, he' SMASHING THE FUCK OUT OF THE OFFICE. His boys split up, b Bryan, block the doorway -- no one in, no one out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cube SMASHES the GOLD and PLATINUM RECORDS on the WALLS, ARTWORK, the GLASS COFFEE TABLE. Pretty much everything e that's breakable.

dialogues.speaker: MONEY
dialogues.text: But Cube keeps on SMASHING, until there's nothing left to smash. THE OFFICE IS COMPLETELY DESTROYED. Cube's out of breath, but he looks pretty exhilarated. He drops the bat on the floor, walks out of the decimated office, followed by the other guys. Bryan remains standing there, speechless, in shock --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre, Eazy, Ren and Yella work on their follow-up album. D.O.C.'s here, too, drinking gin, straight, buzzing. IN THE BOOTH, Ren's recording REAL NIGGAZ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Prisoner like a hostage. You shoulda covered your muthafuckin' head like an ostrich. Deep in the dirt cause you a sucka. And your ass up high so I can kick the muthafucka -- Dre watches from the board, uncharacteristically detached

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm talkin' about. Cube ain't shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you figure? That record's still the hottest shit out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For real. Cube killed it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why we gotta go hard at him. We gonna look like some bitches if we just take that shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take what? (beat) I don't know what the fuck you talkin' about. I like that shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yella nods, but Dre doesn't even respond. Just keeps plod away on the board as D.O.C. proceeds unsteadily toward th door, bumping into Eazy on the way --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, why you gotta be drunk all the time? Get your shit together. D.O.C. keeps on walking, barking back:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your own shit together, lil nigga -- As he exits we focus back on the studio. One thing's clea no one's enjoying themselves anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eazy enjoys dinner with a lovely, put-together young woma TOMICA. She's nobody's groupie. She's serious, and smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is nice. Wow, I didn't realize this was a real "date" date. I thought we were just going out to eat. You bring all your females here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the special ones. (beat) Actually I've never been here before, but I heard it's good. (Jokingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High as it is, it better be. He smiles. She laughs affably, shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I have a job, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Miss Record Executive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Executive Assistant. Ya know, you don't have to impress me. We could've went to Fat Burgers. I just like hangin with you. You make me laugh. That's good enough for me, you know? We can just chill. Eazy nods, knows she's right. His eyes catch a SEXY WOMAN sashaying past. He SMILES at her, and she SMILES back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to Tomica, who just saw the whole thing... she's not mad. She's grinning confidently, seen it before doesn't sweat stuff like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she had a nice ass. But she might wanna fix those teeth. Eazy laughs. He knows a lot of women, but it's no wonder Tomica's his favorite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre's bobbing his head to something dope -- HIS CAR PHONE RINGS. He turns down the music. Answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wuddup. In an instant, his face sinks -- He SLAMS the breaks, ban U-Turn and SPEEDS TOWARD --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre's CAR jumps up to the curb, in a red zone. He doesn't care. He hops out and runs through the sliding front door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre stands at the bottom edge of the bed, looking down at D.O.C, unconscious, head bandaged, tubes in his face. SUG stands a few steps away, looking somber, but still fillin the room with his bulk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc shouldn't even be alive. He got thrown from the car-- hit a tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn. Is he paralyzed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. His throat got crushed. Doctor said he'll never talk right again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vocal chords?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All fucked up. Career could be in jeopardy (beat). Where's Eazy and Jerry? Dre takes the moment in. He's honest about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Them niggas ain't loyal. Taking they're fuckin' time to come see the man. That's why I got my people looking into his contracts at Ruthless. Gotta protect what he got left. Suge looks at Dre, clocking his expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think about Jerry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He aiight. I guess. Suge nods. Contemplative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your paperwork? Is it cool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. I just focus on the music. (beat). Maybe your people could look into my shit too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most definitely. I can arrange that. D.O.C. groans and turns in his sleep. Both of his friends look down at him, quietly watching with concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUBE sits at the head of a long conference table beside K He looks DIFFERENT now -- shaved head, no more Jheri curl Bryan Turner emerges from outside the office, CD in hand. He's trying to keep the mood upbeat, though clearly the p dynamic between them has shifted toward Cube's advantage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cube, Kim -- Great to see you guys. How's that new house treating you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new house is great. Thanks for asking. How's the new office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRYAN TURNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (making light of it) Great. I never did like the design of the old one anyway. Bryan chuckles and looks over at Cube-- who doesn't seem the mood for small talk. Cube notices the CD in Bryan's h CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you got, Bryan? I know you called me up here for somethin'. BRYAN TURNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the new NWA record. I wanted to play it for you first, before you heard it anywhere else -- Cube looks at Bryan, confused: Snatches the CD and he's a the CD player before Bryan can blink. BRYAN TURNER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About one minute in -- Cube hits PLAY -- Tracks forward. Then he, Kim and Bryan listen to REAL NIGGAZ on the conference room's stereo sys DRE (ON TRACK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... We started out with too much cargo. So I'm glad we got rid of Benedict Arnold. Cube doesn't say anything, but his face shows his anger. CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict Arnold. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're trying to call you some kind of a traitor. CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a traitor!? I didn't say shit about NWA on Amerikkka's Most Wanted! But now they're trying to diss. Okay. CLOSE ON Cube's eyes, full of fire -- Kim notices Cube building tension. She gently rubs his arm and leans in cl to whispers-- KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, tell me what you're thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't wait to get to the mothafuckin' studio!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUBE at the mic, spitting with the most audacious fury we ever seen on the most brutal diss track ever: NO VASELINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God DAMN I'm glad y'all set it off. Used to be hard, now you're just wet and soft. First you was down with the AK. And now I see you on a video with Michel'le. Lookin' like straight Bozos. I saw it comin', that's why I went solo. At the BOARD, JINX looks to THE LENCH MOB in the room -- shit, this is getting real --

dialogues.speaker: A78 INT OR EXT. SOMEWHERE IN THE CITY
dialogues.text: Dre and D.O.C. sit and listen to NO VASELINE-- with every line D.O.C. makes a different "dunk face" indicating how embarrassed he is for his homie Dre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yella Boy's on your team so you're LOSIN'! And yo, Dre? Stick to producin'. Callin' me Arnold, but you Been-A-Dick. Eazy saw your ass, and went in it QUICK. As we pan over to Dre, we can see that he kind of digs th creativity and lyrics. He confirms it with a slight smirk chuckle. Clearly blowing the song off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO VASELINE CONTINUES over -- Jerry and N.W.A., minus Dre and D.O.C., listen to the tra faces grimaced:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all disgrace the C-P-T. `Cause you gettin' fucked out your green by a white boy, with No Vaseline. Ren and Yella slouch in the corner, looking very unhappy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUBE (ON TRACK) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... So don't believe what Ren say, cause he goin out like Kunta Kinte. But I got a whip for ya, Toby; used to be my homie, now you act like you don't know me -- But Cube has saved the best for last. He unleashes upon E and JERRY, who LISTEN intently, jaws dropped. CUBE (ON TRACK) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You little maggot, Eazy E turned faggot. With your manager, fella, fuckin' MC Ren, Dr. Dre, and Yella. But if they were smart as me, Eazy E would be hangin' from a tree. With no vaseline, just a match and a little bit of gasoline. Light 'em up, burn 'em up, flame on. Til that Jheri curl is gone. On a permanent vacation, off the Massa plantation. Heard you both got the same bank account -- Dumb nigga, what you thinkin' about? Get rid of that Devil real simple: put a bullet in his temple. Cuz you can't be the Nigga 4 Life crew with a white Jew tellin' you what to do -- Jerry looks absolutely livid, while Eazy just looks caugh off guard. Jerry gets up and TURNS OFF the music -- YELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That shit's kinda funny. Everybody gives YELLA the look. REN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mothafucka got us! What we gonna do? I got my pen ready to serve that fool. Just say the word. Eazy is still trying to digest the track. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll sue that worthless fuck. Defamation, libel... That anti- Semitic piece of shit, I'm gonna call up my friends at the J.D.L. and we'll see how he likes that, little bastard. (off Eazy's despondent look) Eric, come on, we gotta get organized here, we gotta fight --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, Jerry. Relax man. Niggas don't know what anti-Semitic means - - It's just a battle rap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still hopping mad)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always knew Cube was a rotten human being. And people are gonna know the facts. I'll make sure of it. I can't believe you're not as angry as I am, what's wrong with you? Didn't you hear what he said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard it, Jerry. You deal with it your way, I'll deal with it mine. All we got to do is hit the studio and end this boy career.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know about all that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well call Dre and you guys go do it! And Jerry storms out, leaving the crew behind --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, E. Who work for who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you see sitting in the big chair mothafucka?! Eazy re-establishes that he's the top dog at Ruthless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry pulls into his driveway, gets out of the car, carry a bag of groceries, starts walking toward the door. He he a CAR DOOR SLAM, and he TURNS, sees a gleaming-new EL CAM parked across the street. A very large BLACK MAN we haven seen before has emerged, and is walking toward him. The Man STOPS about fifteen feet away from Jerry, and sta there, just staring, patiently, ominously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help you with something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This your house? Jerry looks at the Man. Glances up and down the street. There's nobody around. It couldn't be quieter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's asking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a real nice house. Jerry glances at the front door of the house. Seems to be gauging, in his mind, how long it will take to get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? Are you with Suge Knight? Someone else? Ice Cube? The Man doesn't answer. Instead, he just gazes upon the house, the lush surrounding lawn, the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have yourself a good night, Jerry. He makes a hat-tipping gesture to Jerry. Except he's not wearing a hat. Then he walks back to the car, climbs insi Jerry watches him go, alarmed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are in a HALLWAY adjacent to the AUDITORIUM where a RA PANEL is about to take place. Find CUBE drifting down the escalator along with THE LENC MOB, and they're all decked out in their Lench Mob Gear. Coming up the escalator on the other side, is the rap gro ABOVE THE LAW (ATL), all wearing gear blazing the RUTHLES RECORDS logo. As the two groups approach each other, they both get QUIE and their faces pull into angry sneers. The animosity bet the two groups is tense, palpable, dangerous. Just as they're about to PASS each other --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' traitor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Cube and his boys heard that shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck'd y'all say!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruthless, muthafuckas! AND THEN IT POPS OFF! Some of the ATL CREW hop the escala divider, others sprint down the other side to attack -- THE LENCH MOB CREW, at the foot of the escalator, they al start BRAWLING like crazy. PUNCHING each other in the fac grappling, cursing -- There's so many FISTS flying -- such a tangle of BODIES - it's hard to tell who's hitting who. It's fucking CHAOTIC UGLY, and it culminates in -- The moving violent mass SMASHING INTO A LARGE GLASS DISPL SHATTERING it. Just then -- A LENCH MOB GUY runs up to a downed an ATL GUY, winds bac kick him while he's down, but before the kick lands, we -

dialogues.speaker: A83 ARCHIVAL FOOTAGE
dialogues.text: An OFFICER KICKS the downed RODNEY KING while three other L.A.P.D. OFFICERS (known as the L.A. Four) mercilessly be the man. We all recognize this as the RODNEY KING BEATING Raw, gritty, horrific. WE PULL BACK to reveal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The members of NWA (minus Cube, of course) watch the NEWS FOOTAGE while in the studio, finishing up some new TRACKS their follow-up album NIGGAZ 4 LIFE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still can't believe it. It's like they're enjoying themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Least they got it on video. LAPD gonna have a real good time on that level 3 prison yard, know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep, we got they asses this time. Tape don't lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is over-crowded -- because everyone has an ENTOURAGE. JERRY is also there and he doesn't look thrill about it, nor is he happy to see -- SUGE KNIGHT in the room, hovering behind DRE at the Board accompanied by a very large GERMAN SHEPHERD. Jerry tries to make his way over to Dre, but SUGE blocks path, and the HUGE DOG stares at Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just need a word with Dre --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can wait. Let the man work. Jerry looks at the dog, the dog looks back. Stymied, Jerr turns and exits the studio, jaw clenched. After he leaves, Dre sighs. He looks tired, depressed. Totally over it. He PLAYS BACK the track he's been workin on, listens. Tries to feel it. But something's missing. Irritated, Dre gets up, exits the studio. Suge follows --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suge comes out the back door just behind Dre --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo Dre. Hold up. -- gestures for Dre to sit with him at a nearby table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did what you asked. Had my people look into your contracts. Dre's interest is piqued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't good. Not that I'm surprised or anything. Gotta watch yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you mean by that? Suge pulls out a thick FILE. Places it on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything you need to know. It's all in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off Dre's sober look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I can help you with this. Dre considers a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. I got this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eazy sits alone in the studio, listening to some NEW TRAC It's late, and there's nobody else around as -- Dre comes in through the door, holding the FILE from Suge Eazy notices the file, along with Dre's nervous energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what'd you wanna see me about? Sounded all worked up on the phone. Dre sits down across from him, full of purpose, fired up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you don't like hearin' this shit. But it's about Jerry. We gotta get rid of that muthafuck --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that seriously the reason you wanted to talk? I thought we were past all that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found out some information, Eric. Real shit. I had some people look at this, and I ain't gettin' my fair share. Eazy finally turns and looks Dre in the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why you rich, Dre? You know why you live in a big ass house and don't sleep on a couch no more? Do you know why you fuck the finest bitches? That's Jerry, dude. He broke us through the door. He made this shit happen, and you wanna turn on him just like Cube --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cube was right, fool! You gotta look at these papers, E. Just look and you'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We made it because our shit is dope, Eric, not because of Jerry. We can keep going and own the goddamn world, we just can't be fuckin' with him no more. Eazy just shakes his head, turns back to the Board. Dre l pained. Can't believe he can't get through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude. We go back a long, long way. You and me. We started this NWA shit. I just want it to be right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think that's right, turning your back on somebody? After all he's done for us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean all he's done for you. Eazy doesn't say anything. Dre stands up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me, man. Why won't you look at me? It's like I don't mean shit to you. Like I never meant shit. Eazy won't look at Dre, shrugs. Cruelest shrug you ever s Dre looks hollowed out by it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you were my brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you were mine, too. Dre walks out the door -- SLAMS it so hard, the walls sha A platinum NWA record slides off the wall, breaks on the floor. Eazy FLINCHES, even though he wishes he didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ren and Yella enter to find Eazy on the mixing board, mor than a little out of his element. They look at one anothe confused -- Clearly, something's up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything cool, E?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. Eazy just keeps poking around on the board..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo where Dre at anyway --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, fuck Dre. They've finally got Eazy's undivided but heated attention

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatchu mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't y'all ask him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you talkin' about? He comin' or not --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That nigga quit. So nah, he ain't comin'. But fuck it, we gonna keep this shit movin'. Don't need that punk anyway... Disbelief washes across Ren and Yella's faces as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suge grits on a cigar sitting next to Dre who's at the mi board working on the track to "Deep Cover".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This shit sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of this means anything, while I'm under contract with Ruthless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about that. I promise you that I'll get you out of your contracts. Dre gets back to the work at hand as   -- Warren G and SNOOP DOGG burst into the studio. Snoop Dog dressed head to toe in blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, Cuz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snoop greets everyone around the room pounding each and e person. To the surprise and dismay to the room full of bl especially Suge Knight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo who the fuck's this, Warren?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snoop Doggy Dog, Cuz. Who are you? The Bloods around the room are tripping on Snoop. Before escalates, Dre gets up, greets Snoop properly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad y'all came by. Your demo was tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Dre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well listen, I'm workin' on a track for this movie called "Deep Cover." I want you to get down on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For real? Dre smiles back at Snoop: Yup, for real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hell yeah... Snoop walks into the booth, puts on some headphone's as w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGS. Eazy answers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to talk about them contracts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't wanna talk to Jerry. It's your company. You're the man. Eazy doesn't say a word, considering, deeply conflicted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come by the studio. We'll be here all night. Just workin'. We just wanna squash this. Make it right for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked across the street, Eazy looks at the building, not happy about it. Enemy territory. He opens up his STASH BO a hidden panel below the radio. There's a PISTOL inside. reaches in, puts his hand around it. Hesitates, hearing - A DISTANT POLICE SIREN. Pulls his hand away, leaves the piece. He hops out of the car, walks toward --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eazy enters the Studio, sees only SUGE sitting there, smo a cigar, petting his DOG. He comes further into the room, peeks around, looking for --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell is Dre? You said he'd be here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about Dre. (beat) Truth be told, he ain't got nothing to do with this right here. Suge pulls out a sheaf of papers, and a pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's what's gonna happen. You're gonna sign these. Releasing Dre and The D.O.C. from Ruthless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever homie. You think I'm signing that shit, you crazier then I thought. I'm out -- Eazy just laughs, heads for the door. But before he gets there, it OPENS, revealing -- A LARGE DUDE wearing Blood-Red. He enters the studio, cro his arms. A massive barrier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw. I think you gonna stay awhile. SLAM! Eazy SPINS to see TWO MORE BLOODS entering through side door. One of them holds a metal BASEBALL BAT. The ot has a SHOTGUN dangling at his side. Eazy now realizes he's just walked into a straight-up buz saw. But he shows no fear. He puffs his chest out. EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Suge. I ain't scared of none you niggas, cuzz! Suge just stares at Eazy a long uncomfortable while. SUGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can talk tough all you want-- but this ain't no record. (heart attack serious) Don't make me change you, Eric Wright. EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck is that supposed to mean? SUGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These niggas will take something from you that you can't get back. BLOOD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let me murder this Crab, Suge. Suge stands, eyes cold, black, as the THUGS moves behind Eazy. SUGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw. That's too easy. (to Eazy) I got a whole night planned for you if you don't sign them release forms. Eazy's eyes shoot to the Blood, back to Suge. SUGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could happen quick, Eric. Or it could take a long, long time. You better choose right. Because you know where I come from. This Bompton nigga! EAZY'S FACE can't hide his fear anymore. Or his anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (so quiet, to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dirty mothafucka... WHAP! A large HAND falls on Eazy's SHOULDER -- pushing hi hard down in a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eazy sits slumped in a chair, drinking a beer next to the pool. His eyes look hard, flat, broken somehow -- CLICK! THERE'S A GUN TO HIS HEAD, revealing -- JERRY, in his BATHROBE looking freaked out, holding the g He immediately LOWERS it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Eric. You can't just... I thought you were -- But Eazy isn't rattled at all. He just sits there, blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are yo okay? Eric. Why don't we go inside? All right? Come on... Jerry helps Eazy out of the chair, ushering him into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eazy follows Jerry into the kitchen as Jerry pulls some leftovers from the fridge. Slides them over to Eazy. But isn't interested. Instead, he pulls out a bag of weed. Ro a joint, lights it. Takes a long drag -- Exhales a lot mo than just smoke...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. You gotta tell me what's going on. I can tell when something's -- Eazy leans on the counter. Finally looks at Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta kill that mothafucka, Suge. I just wanted you to know that shit's about to get thick around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gonna do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't come over here to ask you - - I came to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EAZY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You the one that wanted to be down with this gangsta shit. So here we go. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do that, it's gonna ruin everything we've built -- Eazy suddenly SNAPS into intense anger -- EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to do it! This is the streets, muthafucka! I don't have a choice! He came at me! He came at us. We don't hit back, it's over! Done! Put a fork in this shit! Jerry closes his eyes, takes a breath. Tries to keep his relaxed, so that he can, in turn, relax Eazy. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric. Listen to me. I never said we won't hit back. But this isn't Compton. We don't hit back with bullets. We do it with lawyers. We drain those assholes. Eazy calms down a little bit. EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care about the money, Jerry. Ain't about the money. Jerry puts a fatherly hand on Eazy's shoulder. Looks at h JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it is. You're smarter than those criminals. You wanna kill somebody? Then you'll be in prison, forever. No more family. No more Ruthless. No more anything. Eazy stares back at Jerry. JERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you kill this man. His problems are over and yours are just beginning -- Lets hit 'em where it really hurts. Eazy is more conflicted then ever before --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the darkness we see movement. It's Eazy. He moves a slow and laborious fashion as he enters -- THE BEDROOM where Tomica sleeps in their bed, safely tang in sheets. Eazy doesn't even bother shedding his clothes. Simply slumps closer, sliding quietly under the covers. Without a word, she wraps Eazy in an embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim looks on as the CNN CREW's CAMERAS FILM CUBE in the m of a tense INTERVIEW -- A JOURNALIST peppers him with questions:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Anti-Semitic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I thought this interview was about the Rodney King trial?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The J.D.L. has recently gotten involved, saying that the lyrics regarding your former manager Jerry Heller -- But Cube's too smart to fall for this crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not Anti-Semitic. I'm Anti- Jerry Heller. Let me ask you a question -- do they condone Jerry's behavior when it comes to my situation? Him trying to get me to sign a contract without legal representation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you get me that answer and then we can continue on this topic. Until then, let's talk about the beating of an unarmed motorist -- Rodney King and the trial of 4 guilty L.A.P.D. Officers who seem to be Darryl Gates' standard issue -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it isn't just the Jewish community. The Korean grocer community have also accused you of racism, mostly because of your song "Black Korea" --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, man. That don't even make no sense. Black Korea is just a warning. That's it. I'm a journalist, just like you! Reporting on what's going on in the hood. But the difference is that I'm brutally honest about it. Cause sugar coating will get you diabetes. A couple of members of the Nation of Islam are quietly se in the background as the journalist struggles, tries to g a foothold --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your relationship with the Nation of Islam? Cube just smiles, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There my brothers. That question alone just proves how unprepared of a "sandbag reporter" you really are. You wanna talk about Anti- Semitism? Then it's "Black Korea," and now you wanna talk about the Nation of Islam? Seriously, man. What's your agenda? You can't focus on one thing? Ask me something interesting. I'm not an elected official. I'm an artist. You haven't asked me one damn question about music. I'm America's conscience. I represent the good, the bad and the ugly. What you represent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The massive room's focal point is a BASIC STUDIO SETUP: S some turntables, a mic, some keyboards, a tower of speake

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre sits in the epicenter of it all, motionless, lost. It the first time we've seen him anywhere near a soundboard not creating on it. He just stares into the nothingness - A TAP ON GLASS alerts us to SNOOP, Warren G and DOC (smal scare on DOC's neck) outside. Dre stands. Opens the windo DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you fools doin' out here? WARREN G

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching you daydream for the last five minutes. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raspy voice) Looking stupid as a mothafucka. SNOOP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come take a ride with us Dr. Dre. You gotta get out this house, Cuz and get your mind right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snoop at the wheel, they ride listening to ATOMIC DOG by George Clinton. Snoop's at the wheel, smoking a JOINT (surprise), Dre shotgun, Warren G and D.O.C. in the back. SNOOP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you so tense for, Cuz? DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm cool. WARREN G

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you not. You been up in that house for a month now, and not one track? Wassup, what's wrong? DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First time in my life, I feel like I'm forcin' it. WARREN G

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too much outside interference -- Eazy and Jerry tryin' to starve me out. Playin' games with my money. Tryin' to get me back in there on my hands and knees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that why you ain't got no furniture? Snoop holds out the jay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This shit'll chill you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, that ain't me. I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, big bro. Loosen up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reconsidering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck it, gimme that shit. Dre takes a deep pull, holding it in before COUGHING out massive cloud. They all laugh. And Dre takes another hit. even bigger one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. What is in this shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That shit right there? That's the Chronic. Dre TURNS UP the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never smoked before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I can feel it in my nuts, man. Is that normal? Dre finds himself laughing with the guys as they cruise o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre's behind the SSL, listening to a rhythm based on Leon Heywood's I'M GONNA DO SOMETHING FREAKY TO YOU. Warren G, Snoop, and D.O.C are in different corners of the room. Sm floats over Snoop's head like a halo. The vibe is positive and laid back, but as we look at Dre face we can tell what he's thinking: something's missing. Dre turns to the MOOG Keyboard situated on the side of th board and starts noodling with a melody. It's almost familiar. But not quite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he hits it: Da do dee dah dee dah dah dee do deee... Just like that, we've witnessed the birth of AIN'T NUTHIN BUT A G THANG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. Keep playing that. Dre does the same ten notes -- That's it! It's G THANG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freestyling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One. Two. Three into the Four. Snoop Doggy Dogg and Dr. Dre is at the door... (rap continues) Just like that, musical history is being created.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tapdancing for a slightly fatigued Eazy, Jerry tries hard convince him that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're about to get back into the game in a big way, Eric --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? How you figure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you just trying to insult me? Eazy stares back at Jerry, like indulge me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you forget about Ren's album? Or the fact that you're working on an album that I believe is gonna be bigger than anything NWA ever --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really believe that bullshit? All I know is Cube's doin' big things, makin' movies and shit. And I keep hearin' about this album Dre workin' on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre's a fuckin' producer, Eric! Producer's don't rap! It's never gonna work! Period!

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: 98pt1   OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: I/E. DRE'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: The MUSIC IS BUMPIN'! There's a party going on somewhere this house, but not in this room. We're close up on a pai blue Chuck Taylors with a pair Dickies and boxers draped them. As we pull back, we realize that some LUCKY BASTARD GETTING HEAD from a SEXY WOMAN with nice curves. As we pull back further, we can't even see who the Lucky Bastard is because another AMAZING FEMALE is sitting on h face, MOANING and smoking a blunt. Just as we attempt to register what's going on -- We track another SPECTACULAR FEMALE in a two-piece bikini She grabs the blunt from her, hits it and walks out to th balcony. She blows out the smoke and passes it to one of HOMIES who's already rolling up more blunts from the poun weed sitting on the table in front of him. From there we crane down, passing the DJ rig on the secon floor balcony. Even the DJ has GIRLS around him, a blunt his mouth, and a drink in his hand. We crane down further to the bottom floor where MORE GIRL BIKINIS get sprayed by GUYS with SUPER SOAKERS and CHAMPA BOTTLES. It's an impromptu "wet T-shirt" contest. As we pull back across the pool, a few more TOPLESS GIRLS jump in and we realize we're at one of those famous Dr. Dre/Death Row pool parties. People everywhere. Sex in the air. Freezer-bags stuffed with high-grade weed are being passed out to everybody by Snoop Dogg himself. We catch a glimpse of two nice looking LADIES walking ove the bar. We will come to know one of them as NICOLE. But first-- IN THE GAZEBO, we find Dre smoking a blunt and playing DOMINOES with D.O.C., laughing, blowing off some much-nee steam. Until -- Dre's eyes settle on Nicole, who's different from the res She's not drunk, or dancing, or flirting. She's beautiful but in an understated way. When her friend gets up and wa away, Nicole turns, like she senses Dre's gaze. Looks rig at him, with clear, bright, but wary eyes. He heads over

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like you're ready to go. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I'm just waiting on my friend. I knew I should've drove. DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not having fun? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, it was fun. I had a lot of fun. But now it's starting to get a little wild. DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it does get crazy around here sometimes. (extending his hand) Hi, I'm Andre. WOMAN (NICOLE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. (shaking his hand) I'm Nicole. DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Nicole, why don't you come over here with me and kick it for a while til your friend gets back. She considers a moment. Then -- NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, maybe another time and another place. But not now. And with that, a visibly tipsy Warren G walks over, tryin dump some USED COALS out of a kettle-style GRILL -- WARREN G

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo Dre, we're can I dump this shit? DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it look like I give a fuck right now? Can't you see I'm tryin' to make a Love Connection? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he's trying make a friend connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aiight, regulate that shit! Warren G staggers off with the hot coals. They smile at Warren's walk off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A friend connection?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of friends, I need to go find mine before she gets too lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, seems like you need to get back to your game. I'll talk to you later. She gets up and heads off leaving Dre with a big smile on face. As she goes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'mma find you, Nicole! She turns. Smiles back. Disappears into the party. But it clear he's crushing hard on this girl.

dialogues.speaker: PATIO
dialogues.text: The PARTY is still going strong but we see some underlyin tension developing. On one side, we have SNOOP'S CREW -- many of them straigh Long Beach Rollin 20's CRIPS. While Suge's crew, on the o side, are various Compton BLOODS. SNOOP is FREESTYLING for a small GROUP gathered around hi blowing all their minds --

dialogues.speaker: FREESTYLE TBD...
dialogues.text: Snoop STOPS mid-flow, and STARES, wide-eyed, at the HOUSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuhhhh -- Everyone TURNS! GIRLS IMMEDIATELY START SCREAMING because DRE'S HOUSE IS ON FIRE! Huge orange FLAMES lick up the siding, spreading quickly. BLACK SMOKE pours into the sky

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody SCATTERS, tripping over each other, falling on lawn, because let's not forget everyone is WASTED. Find DRE, watching the flames, almost hypnotized by them, because it doesn't seem real. Warren G staggers up beside him, watching on, eyes like saucers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your house is on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (beat) Shit's crazy, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I shouldn't have thrown them coals in the trash. Dre suddenly snaps out of it. Because --

dialogues.speaker: MY FUCKIN' MASTERS
dialogues.text: Against all logic, Dre storms INTO THE BURNING HOUSE as t SOUNDS of DISTANT SIRENS ring out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre and Suge talk in a corner of the studio. Voices low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean that everyone is passing on this record?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? Dre shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all turned it down. "Too many live instruments. It's not hip- hop."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not hip-hop? Shit, it's the future. Ain't no more money in sampling everythang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy has a lot of money. This is the only shot we got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they walk to the other side of the studio we WIDEN TO REVEAL JIMMY IOVINE. He's older and white, wearing glasse with a baseball cap pulled low over his eyes. JIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extends his hand) Jimmy Iovine. Interscope Records. It's nice to meet you. Dre or Dr Dre. What should I call you? DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre's cool. How are you doing? I heard John McClain gave you my album. What did you think? Jimmy smiles. JIMMY IOVINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it was great. (beat) So, you're the artist on this record. Who produced it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. JIMMY IOVINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who engineered it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. JIMMY IOVINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen. I don't know anything about hip hop. And to be honest with you, I don't necessarily care for it. But I know this is special. The word special resonates with Dre. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. SUGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd love to bring it to Interscope. But there's a problem. JIMMY IOVINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem? SUGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruthless. Lawsuits. (beat) Contracts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about this. Give me three weeks. But I don't want to hear any bullshit about you shopping it anywhere else. If you do that. I believe I can get you out of this mess. Sound good? Suge smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sprawling city of orphans, calm before the storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eazy. You may wanna see this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry turns the volume up as Eazy plops down on the couch beside him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... a stunning verdict of "not guilty" for the L.A. Four today in Simi Valley... PUSH IN CLOSE ON EAZY, seeing the verdict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry? We all ought to be sorry... (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had them on tape -- we had their asses on tape. Eazy continues to watch, pained and perplexed, as we see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cube drives through SOUTH CENTRAL in the epicenter of the unfolding RIOTS. Looting stores. Burning buildings. He drives by GRAFFITI TAGS, many of which say FUCK THA POLICE. He sees a CRIP and a BLOOD, tying their RED and B bandanas together in front of one such tag: a SYMBOL of t GANG TRUCE. NEARBY, crowds of young people CHANT:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No justice, no peace! Everybody say, fuck the police! No justice, no peace! Everybody say, fuck the police! A very proud Cube watches. His own words turned into a unifying slogan for the riots. And we see --

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIVAL NEWS FOOTAGE
dialogues.text: Of the riots -- angry, violent. Years upon years worth of rage unleashed in a three day period. Marshall Law. Polic brutality. Race hatred. The worst of humanity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm now, we behold a virtual wasteland of smoldering car and buildings. Shell-shocked, CITIZENS wander around, try to make their neighborhood livable again as -- A `64 IMPALA rolls down the boulevard. Dre, Snoop, D.O.C. Warren G silently observe the damage, shell-shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eazy cruises down Sunset. He looks older, more anguished.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: He passes by TOWER RECORDS where a massive mural of THE CHRONIC cover art fills up the entire side of the buildin Eazy beholds it with a confluence of admiration and envy. the bite of that really starts to sting, Eazy looks -- ACROSS THE STREET, he spots a BILLBOARD for Cube's movie, BOYZ N THA HOOD. Cube is front and center, alongside CUBA GOODING JR. Eazy can't believe it as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Times are hard. Eazy's not ballin' like he was. Surrounde MOVING BOXES and basic studio equipment, a few HOMIES do their thing on the board, the makings of NEIGHBORHOOD SNI playing, as Eazy, Ren and Yella huddle over -- THREE HUGE, ONE-POUND BAGS OF WEED sit on the coffee tabl They divide them into smaller BAGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So all this weed. It's for your Ruthless artists? EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Havin' some cash flow problems. They can smoke it, they can sell it, I don't care. As long as it keeps 'em off my back for a minute. YELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should think about diversifying into my kinda shit. There's money in there, too. Eazy laughs, shakes his head. EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, makin' pornos? No thanks, man. That's your thing. I'll stick with this music shit. Once my new album right here's done, I'mma be fine -- Eazy starts COUGHING. It doesn't sound great. REN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right, man? EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Just tired. All this shit, downsizin' to a new crib, just weighin' on me. I'll figure it out though. I always do. JERRY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric -- Jerry enters. Approaches Eazy. JERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you come by my office? I need you to sign some checks -- But Eazy doesn't even look up at Jerry. EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll come when I can, Jerry. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric -- But Eazy just keeps ignoring him. Annoyed, Jerry exits --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death Row's a thriving office space, especially in contra to Ruthless. A few DOPE CARS sit parked out front as -- Dre SCREECHES up in his brand-new, WHITE FERRARI TESTAROS Suge's just behind him in a RED MERCEDES SL AMG CONVERTIB A car is parked in Suge's parking space. Suge blocks the in. Suge's Goons wait for him to exit his car. Dre and Su hop out, ALL EYES ON THEM --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, this is just the beginning... We're building an empire. Dre LAUGHS as ... Suge storms off, flanked by his GOONS, bee-lining for the EMPLOYEE'S. He grabs the Employee by the collar and hauls out of his car to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in my spot! The Employee just gapes at Suge, speechless...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suge, it's cool -- Suge shakes the Employee like a rag doll...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you park in my muthafuckin' parking space or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know, I -- Suge pulls out a PISTOL and CRACKS the Employee across th face with it, blood gushing from his nose -- Startled, Dre shoots to a stand. What the fuck!? Even mor when Suge drags the bleeding Employee across the parking before tossing him against a car. Suge give the guy his k

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now move yo' piece of shit and park my car. Wow... The guy is scared and confused at Suge's "power dr request. He slowly takes the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And I bet not see one drop of blood in that mothafucka. And everyone watches in utter silence as Suge spins and struts into Death Row Records brand new offices. LOUD SILENCE. Off Dre, disturbed by Suge's violent display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cube sits in the living room, watching basketball, and do something we haven't seen before: WRITING A SCREENPLAY. Kim walks through, visibly PREGNANT, holding SHEA (1). Ha Cube a beer. He reaches for her, kisses her belly as thei toddler, DARRELL (3), runs in. Hops up on Cube's lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Darrell. What you been doing? -- playin' with Shea? Darrell nods as Kim picks up the remote, starts FLIPPING channels. She STOPS when it lands on THE BOX, which just happens to be playing NWA's STRAIGHT OUTTA COMPTON. Cube watches for a bit, lost in thought --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look how young you guys look. Cube looks for a moment -- shakes his head, in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn... We left some good records on the table... Kim walks closer-- rubs his shoulders lovingly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well-- ain't nobody burnt down the table did they? Ever thought about getting back together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the time. But we've been feuding for so long. It might be "ON" on sight when we see each other. I really don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a shame. It's terrible how money tears us apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-- When it should be bring us together. Somebody always wants more then they're suppose to get. As that's when shit get funky. She nods in agreement -- as he continues working on his script. A movie called "FRIDAY".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre's having dinner with NICOLE -- the woman who rejected at his party. Even though they're both clearly feeling th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you glad I tracked you down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't exactly hiding. They both chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So wassup, you been havin' good time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I mean, I like comin' over your place, but you know, your neighbors be complainin' about "the noise" -- Nicole smiles, shoos Dre. He smiles at her, mesmerized. G damn this girl is special. He fills up their champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think a little more privacy would be better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what, you want me to move?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe. I know of a perfect spot. Plenty of room, and I know the owner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole finally gets what Dre's saying. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a few months, you sure you're ready for that, Andre?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm really feelin' you like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm feelin' you too, but... Nicole considers, conflicted. Dre can't stand it any long

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey you know what, don't worry about it right now. Was just a thought... Dre drinks his glass of champagne down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I don't mean to change the temperature in here. But it had to be crazy, bein' married to a Laker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't what I'd call a good fit. It got crazy once we moved to L.A. I definitely went through some unnecessary shit when he started acting like an asshole. But I have a beautiful son and all that other nonsense is behind me now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, no offense, but I'm a little glad he was an asshole. (raising his glass)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His loss is my gain. To assholes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chin-chin. They share a laugh as Nicole raises her glass -- CLINK. D downs his glass as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre walks Nicole to her door, and pretty soon they're kissing. It's nice, but after a bit, she pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right -- Good night. Dre looks surprised. DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Good night? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay to drive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. They both laugh. NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Andre. DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I can't help thinkin', maybe you want me to come inside... NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I do. DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's different now? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a lot of things to think about. (beat) You're asking me to move in... That's a big step. I like you, Andre. But there's a lot going on around you. DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read the papers. I'm not stupid. I know about the whole Death Row business, the assault charges, the shooting... Just seems dangerous. My son's my world. DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I thought we been havin fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fun is fun, Andre. But I refuse to walk away from one crazy life into another. She kisses him on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll a call you. Nicole turns, walks into the building, leaving Dre standi there, embarrassed, angered. Head full of steam, he stumbles back, hops into his --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre walks into Death Row feeling the sting of Nicole's wo still reverberating in his head as -- We reveal two pitbulls snarling and lunging at each other being restrained by heavy duty chains. The screams and ye of a betting crowd of Bloods permeate the hallway as we s the Death Row signature electric chair squarely at the en guy walking a pitbull on a hain moves pass the screaming Bloods and howling dogs runs into Dre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre, you want to put some money on this red nose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (A little dazed and confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah man, I'm good. The rowdy circle of betters grow more and more boisterous the pitbulls are about to get it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Pac at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Studio A...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear 2Pac's iconic verse from "Hail Mary" as Dre enter the studio as the dog fight starts back in the hallway to reveal -- The control room of Studio A is in complete chaos. Bottle everywhere along with blunt smoke, Homies and Hoodrats. T is in the recording booth spitting out lyrics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's made an alter around him with lyric sheet stands -- stand has 2 to 3 notebooks full of raps on it. When they notice Dre, the engineer stops the track. Dre pushes the talk-back button and looks at Tupac throug the glass. DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha'up Pac? TUPAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit! Wha'up Dre... I'm about to hit niggas in the mouth with this new album. Suge said you got some heat for a nigga. DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nigga what? I do...guess who I worked with last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who dat? Dre hands a CD to the engineer --- DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger fuckin' Troutman. Man this shit is fire. Wait til you hear it. TUPAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! OK what you thinking about calling it? DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking about calling it California love. Dre looks at the engineer ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Press play California Love screams out the speakers... we hear the iconic first few bars with Roger Troutman's signature voi singing, California Love. We hear the sound of what seems like muffled gunshots com from another room. Pop. Pop. Pop. Everyone is like what t fuck. This doesn't sit well with Dre. He exits to see what's up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We reveal a pitbull snarling at an emasculated poor basta that is on the floor all bloody, in his underwear holding glass of champagne. The pitbull continues to lunge at his face looking to rip his soul out. WE REVEAL Suge smoking big cigar and laughing. He's at the center of a room full Bloods and hoodrats plus Blood #1, Goon Girl and Goon #1, intently watching the last moments of this emasculated homeboys toast. Dre opens the door at the far end of the room not expecti to see this spectacle. There's several blown holes in the wall where the gun shots were fired just above the coweri man's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck y'all doin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drunk with power)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo Dre, you just in time. Watch this. Get up! (To the Poor Bastard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what to do. Bruised and bloody with one eye closed shut, the Poor Bas raises the glass with a shaky hand and a quivering voice. bull continues to stand at attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to make a toast... Everyone in the room holds up their champagne glasses. Dr can't believe his eyes. There's even two (plain clothes) duty COPS there with badges and gun holsters -- glasses raised high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to Death Row Records...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Death Row...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clowning him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May the west coast reign forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scared)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May the west coast reign forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOR BASTARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to make a toast to Suge. For making this all happen. SUGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget to toast Dr. Dre. you little bitch ass mothafucka! The Poor Bastard looks over at Dre. DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated) Hold the fuck up! Put cha' glasses down. Put your fuckin clothes on. What the fuck is going on around here?! Seriously, what's going on?! Suge approaches Dre puts his hand on his shoulder. DRE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Suge) Nah Nah... (to Room) What the fuck is this shit. Is this why we got money? To act like we ain't got no god damn sense?! We could of did all this kind of dumb shit back in Compton! (to the room) This what you muthafuckas turned into!? Seriously! SUGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its okay, Dre. The Cop #2 is on the couch with some street girls holding champagne glass in her hand looks at Dre then over to Sug who's laughing. DRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This shit is stupid! Do ya'll know what it took for us to get here. Do y'all know what you doin'? Y'all fuckin' it up! Y'all fucking it up! (to off duty cops) And what the fuck ya'll doing here?! Cop raises the glass. DRE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, ok...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Who fuckin' shit up! You trippin. We can do anything we want to do. We started this shit. This is us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, Nigga. Death Row is us. (pointing around) This other shit -- is you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suge's Goons get in position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better watch ya mouth, Blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Tha fuck you talking too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismissive) Nigga, you ain't nothing but a producer around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sends Dre into orbit. He goes after Blood #1. The wh conference room jumps in between them -- keeping these tw human pit bulls from scrappin'. Everybody jumps but Suge amused by the whole thing -- puffs on his cigar. Dre is b held back by the Off Duties. While Goon #1 is being held by Goon #2 and a few others. World War III averted for no

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck off me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre breaks free and storms out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man don't even trip off this muthafucka. What he going to do? Where he going to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 113pt2 TESTAROSA And just sits there, seething. Reaches in the back seat, grabs a bottle of Hennessey. Takes a swig... Then -- A sudden look of determination washes over him. He TEARS into the street, tires SQUEALING -- ERRRR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PASSING CARS, swerving, Dre punches the gas, RPMs maxed o Shifts, flying through an intersection -- the needle pass 100mph. Keeps going, loving the release, the control... A POLICE CRUISER, coming the opposite direction, spots Dr Testarosa -- In a flash, they bang a U-turn, peeling so f smoke clouds the night air -- ON DRE, distant police lights now strobing off of his fac from the rear view mirror. Fuck! Thinking fast, he switch off his headlights. Hits the gas, needle bottoming-out! As he reaches the next intersection, Dre makes a hard lef SCREECHES to a stop, tucking into a spot along the side o the road. Shuts off his car. Waits, breathing fast, as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on, come -- THE POLICE CRUISER barrels around the corner -- SLAMS THE BRAKES! Two LAPD OFFICERS fling open their doors, guns leveled at Dre's car! Eyes wide, adrenaline coursing through his veins, chest heaving, Dre grits his teeth. He's stuck... and he knows

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver! Put your hands out of your window where we can see them! Now! Dre complies, reaches his hands out of his window. The two officers carefully approach, guns at the ready. OFFICER 2 slaps the cuffs on Dre, regret immediately registering on his face as we --

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Nicole hops out of her car and hurries into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
