dialogues.text: Dre and NICOLE sit across from each other, Plexiglas betw them, talking via phone receivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody else been here to see you, your so-called friends at Death Row?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. You're the only one I wanna see anyway. She surveys him, pain in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 112 days? That doesn't even make sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well... That's what happens when you violate your probation. They sit there, just being in the awkward, contrived mome

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got one phone call and you called me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Cause you were right. Only other person that tells it to me like it is-- is my moms. So I know you care. She looks at him, nods, dabs at her wet eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fucked up. But I've had a lot of time to think in here, and I promise you, things are gonna be different from now on. That lies there a minute. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take care of yourself, Andre. She stands, heads away... And we see the reflexive disappointment on Dre's face before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomica and Eazy lie in bed together. He stares at the ceiling, and she runs her hand soothingly down his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like I don't know what I'm doin' anymore. I don't even know where the money's going. Tomica props herself up on her elbow, looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can help, you know. Show me the files, the bills, the contracts. I know the business, I know how it all works. Let me look. Baby, if you're feelin' this way, Jerry's not doin' right by you. Eazy puts his arm around her, pulls her close. They both there a little longer, just breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. After New York. Workin' on that International Distribution with Sony. Jerry don't know about that. I wanna keep it that way. Tomica nods, smiles. Encouraged he has a plan again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establish MANHATTAN, in winter, after hours. Dirty snow o the sidewalks. Cold-as-shit wind blowing off the Hudson. line of CLUB KIDS on the 12th Avenue sidewalk, in front o the massive brick edifice of the legendary --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ICE CUBE sits in a BOOTH, surrounded by friends, label-ex and hangers-on. It's pretty clear that Cube is a huge celebrity at this point. He even has some big, unsmiling THUGS (The Lench Mob) standing close. Cube, mid-conversation, suddenly STOPS talking... Because SEES that EAZY-E is entering the VIP with 2 HUGE SAMOANS, making his way over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his crew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heads up y'all. This lil nigga might wanna do something. Cube stands up -- ready for whatever. Eazy and his Bodyguards arrives at the booth. There's a t silence -- almost a stand off before anyone speaks. Every looks to them, seeing how they're gonna react. After all, these two have dissed each other, ferociously and publicl for years. Still, Eazy gives Cube a friendly, vaguely submissive smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax everybody. Just came in the club-- heard you were over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Still ready)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm over here. (beat) What you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need shit. Out here with Bone Thugs-- Was just in the neighborhood. Wanted to say wassup. The tension between the sides eases up a bit, but not completely. They both stand there, neither sure what to s to the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saw your movie. It was good. Cube slowly smiles. Knows that wasn't easy for Eazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you said it was an after- school special. They both smile, laugh. Give each other a pound. In truth they missed each other. Homie hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missed you, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missed you too, E. Wish we could've work shit out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess it all happened like it was supposed to. You a movie star-- I'm a music mogul. Dre. Well Dre is tripping right now, but he's doing his thang. Just wanted to come over here and put something on your mind.. Cube is curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The club has mostly emptied out. Only a few die-hards rem as we find Cube and Eazy slumped over their table, loose alcohol. The vibe is cool, friendly, like the old days. B we notice Eazy has a subtle, persistent COUGH...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish all that bullshit never happen between us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EAZY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely never wanted it to get physical-- we should've kept it on wax. CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never should've dissed each other in the first place. Made our fans choice between us. That ain't cool. EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah you right. (After a few beats) Ever though we was going to be this big? CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. I was reminiscing with my wife the other day. What it felt like-- In the beginning. We were so young and ferocious. Doing music straight for the hood. Trying to be ghetto stars... I thought I knew everything back then -- But I didn't know shit. EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither. I'm still trying to figure this stuff out. One minute I'm slangin' in a crack house -- next thing I know, they invite me to the White House. Cube laughs, shakes his head. CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I get it. Everything changes so fast. Feels like it was 20 years ago. If we were still together do you know how large we'd be? They both sit there, thinking about that shit, amazed. EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever think about fuckin' with some new NWA shit? Cube frowns, contemplates for a moment. CUBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be lyin' if I said I never thought about it. Eazy's eyes flash. That's what he was hoping to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too, Cube. Been thinkin' about it a lot. (beat) Be like 1989 again. We changed the world forever. Mothafuckas can never go back to that fake shit after us. It gets no realer then NWA. No matter what... After a quick thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you can get Dre to do it, I'm in. But check this out homie-- I ain't doin' it if Jerry's around. He done made enough off us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you. An EMPLOYEE walks by, pushing a broom, glaring at them. I time to go. They both stand up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. We done talked til the damn club closed -- I got a car coming. You need a ride back to your hotel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, I'm cool. I wanna walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really?)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk? It's cold as fuck Eric, this ain't L.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good. Hit me up later. Another HUG, this one last a little longer then normal. E doesn't say anything else. Just heads for the exit, witho looking back. Cube watches him go off into the cold night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eazy walks back to his hotel in the freezing cold, his ha jammed in his pockets. The wind blows mercilessly. Eazy i shivering like crazy. But he keeps walking. It's a longer walk than he thought. He tries to hail a ca but of course, none stop. He keeps trudging along, his br making clouds, through the lonesome pre-dawn City --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre emerges from the JAIL, shielding his eyes from the suddenly-blinding SUNSHINE. Interestingly, this is the SE TIME we've seen him get picked up from jail. NICOLE is there, waiting by her car. He wraps her in his arms, and they stand that way, together, for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry has the PAPERS on the counter for Eazy's signature. something's different this time. Eazy doesn't just sign. Instead, he starts GATHERING the papers into a pile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, aren't you gonna sign --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'mma take these home with me. I'll sign 'em. Get'em back to you in a couple days. Jerry looks alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this is how we've always done it. You have a lot on your plate Eric, there's no need to add to it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cool, Jerry. They're my bills, my checks. I mean look, my name's right there. Eazy grins at Jerry, points to his name on the checks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wish we could do it here. I don't want anything to get misplaced or lost --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry so much, Jerry. I can handle it. Eazy picks up the pile of papers and heads for the door. Jerry stares after him, visibly shaken --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomica watches on as Eazy finishes READING the immaculate organized PAPERS she's laid out for him. He puts them dow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had to know the truth sometime. Now you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cube tried to warn me. So did Dre. And I didn't listen. I fucked up. And we stay with Eazy a moment, reeling, pissed....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eazy walks into their familiar meeting place to find Jerr slumped at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the fuck have you been? I've been calling you -- Jerry glances down at the PAPERS in Eazy's hand, sees the flat look on Eazy's face... and gets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what was it, the groupie? The executive assistant? Did she even go to college? Come on. You're smarter than that, Eric --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't about Tomica, Jerry. It's about you. And you really gotta stop acting like you never did anything wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know you're upset. But I'd strongly advise you to take a breath, let me look at the paperwork -- Eric lets out a low, rumbling laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry, for real? You can stop givin' me advice. As of, like, now. I'm getting NWA back together. It's happening. But you ain't gonna have nothing to do with it this time. Jerry's voice starts to RAISE in volume, desperation grow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you say something like that? You're not thinking straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what's best for you, and for Ruthless, and we've built a trust over years of hard work. That trust is our foundation, Eric. Eazy laughs again, but this time... the laugh deteriorate into a ragged, hacking COUGH. Jerry watches, concerned --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? You don't look --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust. God damn, that's a word. Let me tell you somethin', Jerry. Trust is a muthafucka. Jerry is now full-on YELLING at Eric, who remains calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if what I've done is so illegal, why have I never been sued? I'm such a thief, such a liar, such a motherfucker, how come nobody's come to collect? This is business. This is how it works. It's not always pretty, but all of it, everything I've put into this company, my whole LIFE for all these years, it's for you, Eric. Eazy absorbs this. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fired, Jerry. Jerry, who is now beet-red, starts to BELLOW with rage --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Eric! This is not how we do things! This is a business and I won't let you -- But Eazy's already out the door. Enraged, Jerry wipes his across the table sending everything SMASHING onto the flo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long gone are the days of the infamous Dr. Dre pool parti as Dre and Nicole relax by the pool. Dre's huge, early-mo CELL PHONE rings from a table beside him. He picks it up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? After a short pause, a familiar, gravelly voice comes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wassup Andre, it's Eric. Dre's eyes widen. Eazy's the last person he ever expected hear from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Wassup wit you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chilling by his modest pool, Eazy looks worn but determin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just felt like callin' -- Dre is still vaguely mystified, at a loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Okay. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wassup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know. Doin' my thing. Makin records. Killin' all that pussy out there. Seated a few feet away from Eazy, Tomica rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just makin' tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Snoop record you did was big. 850,000 copies in the first week?! Congratulations on the success of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good lookin' out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well look, I know you're busy, but I talked to Cube, and we were, like, talkin' about some... possibilities. Dre gets up, walks around the edge of his pool, processin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And by the way, if you ain't heard-- I ain't fuckin' with Jerry Heller no more. Nigga's fired. Something in those words causes Dre to soften... a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. Well it's about time. He's the reason why we broke up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen man, I know everything got messed up and went the wrong way. I wish it didn't. I wish we can go back to the days of Skateland when we were all just young, hungry and ferocious. The world's most dangerous group. Before all the money and fame got between us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah me too-- cause I'm not proud of all the shit I did, either. Eazy looks vaguely relieved Dre said that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you think maybe, we can make somethin' happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's sounds cool -- Let's stay in touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fair enough. They both hang up. Eazy turns to Tomica, big smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody's all in. NWA is back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ren and Yella work the kinks out of a dope new beat -- To enters, Eazy in tow, looking a bit sluggish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wuddup, y'all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey so, when are Dre and Cube gonna roll in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you know -- Gettin' kinda anxious to get this new shit goin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Hopefully soon. Let's just get ready. New NWA gonna change the game, just like back in the day --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No doubt. I got books of new shit -- Eazy's legs buckle. He leans on the Board, winded --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, you alright, Eazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Just. Like. Need some fresh air, somethin' -- PANIC flashes in his eyes as he moves toward the door, suddenly CRUMPLES TO THE FLOOR, out cold --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric! They all hurry over to him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AMBULANCE blares through the night, running red lights hurtling toward the hulking edifice of CEDARS SINAI --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eazy lies in a propped-up hospital bed, watching TV. He doesn't look ill, just annoyed with the situation. Tomica sits in a chair beside him, flipping through a magazine. A young DOCTOR walks in, carrying a chart. He looks troub preoccupied. His eyes dart from Tomica... to Eazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna say something? Is it a respiratory infection -- pneumonia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, well, it is those things... and more, I'm afraid... We ran a full blood battery and -- (beat) Mr. Wright, I'm sorry but you've tested positive for the HIV virus. Tomica reflexively stands, her hand over her mouth. Eazy squints, smiles, looks at the Doctor like he's crazy. EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck outta here. DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The normal T-cell count is anywhere between 500 and 1500. Right now, your T-cell count is... 14. Tomica just stands there, mouth agape, speechless. Eazy's smile slowly fades to a look of pure dread. EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I ain't no faggot. DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wright, there are actually quite a few ways that the virus can be transmitted -- EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's wrong. No way. Test me again. Test my shit again -- DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've actually run the test five times, with five different samples... and the results remain -- Tomica suddenly lets out a choked CRY, runs from the room Eazy watches her go, overwhelmed, confused... and then, a at once, he gets it. Voice trembles a little. EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomica. She's pregnant. Oh fuck. Does that mean she -- DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not necessarily. But we'll need to test her, too. EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we do? What's the treatment? Let's get started. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got work to do. How long's it gonna take to get me healthy again? The Doctor looks at Eazy, struggles a bit. He pulls up a chair, sits down next to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wright. You need to understand. You're very, very sick --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't even feel that bad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With treatment, and palliative care, we can probably keep you comfortable for... maybe six months. At the very most. Panic washes over Eazy in a flood --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comfortable? What you mean comfortable? Six months!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm truly sorry, Mr. Wright. Eazy realizes that he's dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last week, the rap world was stunned to learn in a press conference held by his lawyer, that Eazy-E had been admitted to Cedars Sinai Hospital in Los Angeles and diagnosed as suffering from full- blown AIDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE HEAR the STOCK FOOTAGE CONTINUE over -- At home, sitting on the couch with Kim and their KIDS, Cu watches on, stunned. Kim kisses him, leans on his shoulde they try to process the shock --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eazy started getting sick about a month ago but hadn't shown signs of improvement, so he checked into the hospital. They ran extensive tests and as a result we found out that... he has what he has...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the hospital, we see PEOPLE have started to GATHE About a dozen or so. They stand there quietly, shuffling around, staring up at the Hospital --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomica sits in a chair pulled right beside Eazy's bed. Th hold hands, look at each other. They've both been crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just glad you're okay. You and the baby. Tomica takes his hand, kisses it, cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We can beat this. Together. Eazy nods reassuringly, but you can see in his eyes he doesn't believe it. Eazy's PHONE rings. He answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eazy! What the fuck, cuz? People been sayin' some crazy shit. Like you got AIDS or somethin'? Can you believe that? Muthafuckin' Eazy-E got AIDS? Niggas be starting too many rumors, huh? SILENCE. Ren is hit with the reality as Eazy TURNS OFF th phone -- Sticks it in the bedside table drawer. It's pret clear he's never gonna turn it on again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that? Eazy doesn't respond, just lies there, despondent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre's chilling on a couch as NICOLE appears from around t corner holding a wireless phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for you. He grabs the phone, leans it on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What up. Dre's face contorts with confusion as he listens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomica and Yella stand by Eazy's bedside. Eazy looks drai depressed. Various members of Eazy's FAMILY are also pres Yella holds a CASSETTE in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Bone Thugs' new LP. It's good, Eric. It's gonna be huge when it drops. Everybody thinks so. Want me to play it for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it on the table. I'll listen later. Thanks for stoppin' through. Hit you when I get outta here. Yella nods sadly, places the cassette on the bedside tabl and exits. Handwritten on the cover, it says BONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomica sits holding Eazy's hand, staring at him with haun eyes. RON SWEENEY stands in the background, along with Ea Family. Someone else is there now, too. A PASTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. That's not the way it should happen. It's not right --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. It's gotta happen, baby. I'm having my surgery tomorrow, so it has to happen now. Because I might not. Wake up. Eazy's clearly struggling to come to terms with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOMICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that. EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true, Tomica. I gotta make this right. Ron says it's the only way to protect everything I built. Tomica looks to Ron, who nods. She stares off into space, slowly shaking her head. Her life has become a nightmare. TOMICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so... fucked up -- EAZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Listen to me. It doesn't matter what people think. They don't know. They don't understand. There's no other way. Please. I know it's not the way you pictured it. You deserve better. He reaches out, puts his hand on her stomach. EAZY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if we don't do this, I won't be able to protect either of you. After looking deep into Eazy's eyes -- He needs her. TOMICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I love you, Eric. Ron steps forward, followed by the FAMILY, who gather aro Eazy's bed. Finally, the PASTOR, who smiles kindly at the PASTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we ready? Tomica and Eazy nod their heads yes. The Pastor reaches o holds Tomica's hand in one hand, Eazy's hand in the other PASTOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomica Woods, do you take Eric Wright to be your lawfully wedded husband, to have and to hold... Tomica tries not to cry, but it's impossible. The tears f and all she can do is wipe them away. Eazy won't stop loo at Tomica. Like she's the last thing he'll ever see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the Hospital, the VIGIL has grown in size. There' now about a HUNDRED PEOPLE standing outside. Holding cand Many of them are crying. Holding pictures of Eazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRE quietly enters the room, nobody in there except him a Eazy. He walks to the bed. Looks down at his friend, whom hasn't seen in four years: Eazy's eyes are closed, a RESPIRATOR doing his breathing for him. NOTE: The BONE TAPE is still sitting, untouched, on the bedside table. Eazy never got a chance to listen to it. Dre stands there, staring down, in this extended, surreal moment. He bends down, so his mouth is close to Eazy's ea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Eazy. Wanna tell you somethin'. I know you can hear me. I know you're still in there -- We PULL BACK, so WE CAN'T HEAR WHAT DRE IS SAYING. And we won't hear it, because that's between Dre & Eazy. After a few moments, Dre stands up straight. Whatever he to say to Eazy, he's finished now. He walks to the door - On his way out, he passes TOMICA as she's coming in. He l at her. Then he looks at the ring on her finger. Walks aw without saying a word...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A phalanx of POLICE guards the front entrance, preventing MOB OUTSIDE from getting in. OUTSIDE EAZY'S DOOR, find CUBE sitting in a chair. He spo DRE walking out, looking glazed. Cube gets up. They stand there looking at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S'up Dre?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you, Cube. It's been awhile. Lot of water under the bridge. They fin step to each other, and hug quickly, intensely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see him? How he look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks the same -- like Eric just sleeping. But he's in a coma. Got a machine breathing for him -- Cube frowns, looks at the ground, pained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't see him like that, man. This is bad. I asked one of his homies to call me when he wakes up. Dre nods, doesn't push it. He understands. As they exit together, they pass the Police Guards, in tight formation the door, protecting the Hospital. Protecting Eazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORE PEOPLE keep arriving to the VIGIL. A steady flow. Th all stare up at the Hospital, watching, waiting. The crow STRETCHES far in all directions, clogging the street --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cube lies on the bed with Kim, watching TV. The PHONE RIN on the bedside table. Cube stares at it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone to his ear, Dre listens a while, nods, face desolat Seated beside him, Nicole rubs his back, consoling her ma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Dre hangs up. Looks over to Nicole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone. She hugs him tight as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of quiet beauty. A TIME-LAPSE of the magnificent City of Los Angeles. From hazy, sun-blasted MORNING, to a explosively-hued SUNSET, into the electricity of NIGHT. We hear EAZY'S VOICE, one last time, through some of the final words he released to his fans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TIDES on the beach rise and fall. Endless VEHICLES sw the FREEWAYS like teeming blood vessels in veins. Clouds across the sky like an avalanche, a river --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre strides down the lipstick red hallway, lined with platinum records, a determined look on his face. Enters -

dialogues.speaker: THE CONFERENCE ROOM
dialogues.text: To find Suge, looking confused, sitting at the end of the long conference table. He's wearing another absurd Red-De suit, fedora, gold watch on a chain, flanked by a couple jacked-up BLOODS. And his DOG is still by his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the urgency, Dre?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out, man. I'm out of Death Row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not making any sense. Death Row and Dr. Dre are one in the same. You can't just up and go. Dre does not avoid Suge's gaze. He looks right at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna do my own thing now. Start fresh. Nobody to answer to but myself. It's time, Suge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're one stupid muthafucka. You just gonna throw away all this money? `Cause if you leave, everything we created is mine. Suge starts to breathe hard through his nose. He's pissed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we created? Ha -- Well you can have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't takin nobody with you. Death Row stays Death Row. And if you even think about touching my money? You know how I handle shit. Blue Rev. (9/15/14)            141.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what you gotta do. I'm still out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gettin none of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a fuck-- You can't put a price on peace of mind. So you can keep the artists, the money, the masters and the bullshit. I'm startin' my own thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suge stands there, huge, scary. He stares cold daggers in Dre's eyes, but Dre refuses to look away. Suge finally nods. Something softens in him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you gonna call it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aftermath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre walks away, smiling as -- STRAIGHT OUTTA COMPTON kicks in and we see the people and things that have been impacted by NWA. We begin with all things that made NWA possible. We'll end with all the thi that NWA made possible. A little something we like to cal

dialogues.speaker: BEFORE FINAL CREDITS...
dialogues.text: We'll see the actual real life members of N.W.A. in all o their glory back in the day, chronicling what they went o do, and culminating with a PICTURE OF NWA, staring menaci at the camera. The most dangerous band in the world.
